i can’t speak for how your daughter feels about being one of the only to not have a phone with her peers she probably feels left out but i don’t think not having robolox youtube tic toc is a disservice and i wouldn’t allow her access right away or at all that’s up to you but i think she should maybe for christmas if you celebrate get a phone with restrictions that at least allow her to contact you approved contacts and restrict to time use at home example have her put the phone in the kitchen or your room to charge at pm pm can’t use it at home unless homework is done additional rule is keeps it on when she’s out at a friends so you can alway las reach her she can reach you

i’m sure she feels excluded and it’s helpful to talk about that and maybe have monitored minute daily sessions or somethn but as someone who studies neurodevelopment you’re doing the right thing esp cause she has adhd the longer kids can stay away from devices the better their emotional regulation is likely to be given that they also have adequate support its not just about screens kudos to you guys for doing this

i don’t allow my y o to have tiktok or twitter he doesn’t have ig as he needs it for a class and these kids don’t care about fb lol when he plays games he never uses chat or speaks with strangers there was a time that happened and he got in big trouble and had to earn everything back all the kids around here just facetime each other and play they don’t think it’s as fun when talking to others

yea i think you are doing your daughter a disservice because you are basically saying that you don’t trust her and you don’t think she’s old enough to understand the dangers you are going to be disappointed when you realise that she will be able to access the internet in many other places and you will probably have no clue about it because i bet you she’s the only one who’s parents are over protective if you have honest conversations with your children from the earliest times then you are giving them the tools to make good decisions you are nearly forcing her to break the rules just so she is part of the conversation don’t be so cruel

former parenting coach here and mom of years fwiw allow access in small supervised doses and utilize every parental control imaginable but also talk with them about what to expect to see when hanging with friends yep like porn because it's going to happen be proactive instead of reactive and show them you are a safe space to talk about their experiences this will possibly prevent a lot of sneaking around or feelings of shame and guilt that will shut down open communication between you you don't have to be graphic or anything but at least lay the groundwork in small doses the more you restrict especially without explanation the more enticing something becomes edited a typo

my yr old has a phone but it’s an iphone and her account is set up as a child’s account she needs to ask my permission to download anything and i can monitor her phone from my devices i have not allowed her access to social media yet she’s one of the last in her grade to have no social media accounts i do not regret it

as someone who grew up similarly yes you're setting her back socially i cannot say it did not impact where i am now because it absolutely did limiting use is all well and good but denying such an integral part of society completely puts kids in really messy situations being ostracized sucks being bullied is worse

well for me i think we have to accept this is a digital world now and a lot of socialising is done on these apps your kid needs to learn how to use them what to be mindful of how to behave online what to alert you to etc life skills nowadays includes how to manage social media it is something you need to arm your kid with as to when you think it’s appropriate for your kid i mean you know your child best and their environment it’s kind of up to you for me at i would feel it’s reasonable to allow some access

no this is just good parenting you know your kid using what other people do as a barometer is a bad idea the majority of parents are lazy and let their kids do whatever and eventually will pay for that social media and phones are absolutely screwing up kids and adults bad

you know movies have a rating called parental guidance advised i find that if my kid experience something for older audience but i'm there to answer her questions and guide her the end result is way better than if she listened to it alone the same can be done with roblox youtube and tick tock you play listen with her answer her questions and show her how to use those things in an healthy safe way i had a neighbour kid come over and start talking about what clearly a minecraft streamer saying things about subscriber i asked him if he knew what a subscriber was he did not know i feel repeating things without understanding is where the danger is and the more something is prohibited the more chances you won't be there to guide her when she does try those things youtube and tick tock can be good learning platform roblox can be a good social platform you start by doing it together and over time as you see her use it you could get to a point where you let her use it at limited time alone and if she doesnt use it in a good way she loses access that one hell of a motivator she could go from my parent are too strict and to i lost my roblox privilege because i was speaking with people i did not know when i knew it was not allowed

this is a tough one me and the wife are younger parents to an year old and we let him use roblox and youtube we do our best to monitor what he does and so far no issues or concerns but he does have friends who are on strict no phone or youtube and i can tell those kids are not included in everyone’s playtime as they don’t understand the references as they get older they will all share their interests and dislikes i would be worried i am ostracizing my child from his peers by being too strict we had a very serious conversation before we let him start using roblox about weirdos on the internet and too never engage anyone and tell us if anything happens i definitely do agree it’s a risk as the internet can be dangerous and full of weirdos

i think you’re doing great by allowing some access to technology but not completely keeping her from it when they get older you just have to adjust it’s hard but i do think you should try to integrate some stuff to make it seem like they aren’t missing out regular youtube can be pretty bad that’s why i like youtube kids you can pick individual creators and other content so that you know what they’re watching you can start by picking stuff and previewing it although i’m not sure at what age this becomes pointless tiktok is a hard no many predators on there and messed up stuff a kid that age doesn’t need to be exposed to there’s actually no value to it unlike youtube where there’s lots of easy to monitor content that can be educational or fun youtube is already not great for adhd kids if they tend to flip through stuff so tiktok would be a pretty tough one on the attention span with the short videos and whatnot roblox is tough there’s a lot of content on there that’s fine but the kids and adults may not be it helps that they’ve really limited what can be said on chat but if you’re still worried you can filter this by turning off chat options but i’m not sure how easy it would be for a kid her age to undo that and haven’t had to do that myself yet i recommend monitoring her chats with friends i personally know parents who’s children have sent images to friends that they shouldn’t have and those things have been shared and lots of bullying that can happen don’t do this behind her back i would say that you just need to have a conversation with her about how things can be safe and you want to make sure she is safe not that you are constantly looking at stuff but that you will check in occasionally to make sure everything is pg or if you feel like you don’t want to intrude at all there may be a way to prevent picture sharing etc on the kids messenger app i think in a couple years these restrictions can be lifted as you see fit but regardless you need to have a conversation with her about the internet if you haven’t already this can be as simple as hey just like the real world the internet isn’t safe always there is adult stuff that you don’t want to see and that there are people that may try to talk to you for the wrong reasons this is why you only talk to people that you know in real life that are your friends in chat if you’re on roblox and you’re playing with someone you don’t know do not give out personal information because we don’t know who they are and there’s no way of knowing you don’t want a stranger to know where we live or your full name because we don’t know if they are safe even if you think they may be nice in a couple years you can add more details as questions may arise another thing is you let your kid know that if there’s anything that they see or find on the internet that makes them feel weird or scares them they can always come to you and talk about it you won’t be mad there’s a lot of things children just won’t understand and may not be ready to be exposed to you’re there for them and can help explain anything that may be weird you’re right sometimes it can be a disservice when they get old enough to make those decisions or go behind your back and haven’t had any of this conversation or exposure to the internet it can put them in very dangerous situations you’re doing great hope this helps

my son has adhd and he has had a phone since he was in kindergarten our routine was it would go in the backpack when he got home it would go straight to a bowl if he wanted to use it for games he would ask and we would let him have it for min during the week as long as homework and chores were done i also installed google family link both my husband and i are supervisors and can lock his phone from anywhere or block apps however he didn't start to use it for friends until the last months my kids are not allowed to play roblox but they do play minecraft my husband will also play with them at times he also started playing that with friends he prefers to use kid messenger to chat with his friends too youtube we have it restricted to older kid on google family link i do check to see what he's watching sometimes to make sure he's not watching anything he shouldn't now that he likes his phone even more we switched our house to earning phone time he recently got braces so good teeth brushing earns phone time chores and homework earn phone time behavior and doing his best in school just like any kids we have not approved apps or purchases taken the phone away for not listening etc at times i've had to lock his phone so i could get his attention once he's done what i needed i unlock it and he can go back to what he was doing we also have set times for when the phone will lock for the night and unlock the next day it's always the same time every day so there aren't surprises one of our biggest rules is if they complain over this then they won't get their phone the next day i try to give them a min warning before the phone will lock for the night and that seems to help overall we can control content and usage he knows and it's not an issue since it's been like that from the beginning

there is gabb wireless which is a phone without internet you can take photos text amd talk my yo has one because we want to be able tor each her when she isn't with us but don't feel she needs internet on thr phone she has a computer and tablet and an old phone of mine to use at home only for data so she doesn't need a smart phone just food for thought

mine is almost with adhd as well he has a flipphone but that's it he has access to an old smartphone but it can only be used on wifi and it's usually just used when we play pokemon go we've talked a lot about how he's going to hit milestones at different times than his friends sometimes sooner sometimes later i've also discussed with him how impulse control is a struggle that many folks with adhd face and that dad and i will sometimes say 'no' for him if we don't think he can consistently do it himself all of that said having access to the old smartphone has been a good gauge a couple of years ago he would try to sneak it to bed or find workarounds for the parental controls he's got a lot more respect for the rules now and he understands if they're broken the phone goes away for a while all that to say you're not a terrible parent for not priming your kid's brain to be addicted to tech before she's even old enough to drive kids have lived for thousands of years without cell phones and anyone who would ostracize or bulky her for not having a phone isn't a friend she wants anyway
i wasn’t allowed a phone until th grade and it definitely affected my social life for the rest of school maybe get her a phone and have a rule where she leaves it in your room at night

it could very ostracize her i have a daughter the same age but she like many kids have had phones for years now my daughters use iphones they have to get permission that is sent my iphone and requires my face id to download any apps i also have their log ins for all of their accounts you could still get her a phone but keep the apps under control by making all app downloads need permission and keep her to youtube kids rather than all access to youtube i would still make it a requirement that you need to be in the room when she uses youtube kids or if you allow tiktok you must be in the same room i understand the reasoning you want to keep her from these platforms kids her age and younger are given unmonitored access to these things which i believe is dangerous and far too much freedom a good balance can be found and as my kids grow and they are able to earn more freedoms

oof thats a genuinely tough question will she be different than everyone else yes *but is that a bad thing * unclear i'm planning to wait until my daughter is at least to let her have a phone but seeing as how she wont be born for a few more months we'll see how my opinion changes in the coming years this technology is new and the long term consequences on children is not yet fully understood but everything i've read suggests that the longer you can wait the better but you also have to balance that with how society is shifting to become increasingly digital you can go ahead and send your kids to the park to play but they're not going to meet other kids there lack of exposure to this new reality will make it harder for them to relate to their peers so you have to weigh that cost against the cost of giving her those screen

best advice raise your kids how you see fit within great moral boundaries of course if you are trying to keep them less mainstream ask people going your route it's called support don't seek support from your greatest critics you seek criticism from them just make sure that you incorporate the examples of the negatives that you are working to avoid it will have to make sense to them

i have a yr old soon to be i gave him a phone he turn it off in school he doesn’t have social media or tiktok he also has adhd he is not included in the class chat and i think is better he use roblox to play with his friends they have parental controls they can’t upload anything without my consent also i have him the phone to be able to call me or dad now he can be at practice alone and call me when is time we don’t have land phone so is very convenient he communicates with all my family called grandma’s etc the thing is the most you don’t allowed something is worst better to teach them how to use things i will not allow him to use social media yet but definitely he feels more secure to be able to call anyone if he needs to

our boys got phones at the year before secondary school as it would be then they'd be expected to walk to and from school alone the important thing for kids this age is not removing access it's limiting access put strong parental controls on the phone i use family link which sets a time limit doesn't allow download of apps without parental acceptance and sends alerts should they try and access anything they shouldn't at nearly i still have these controls on my twins phones with their consent as they recognise they have poor impulse control otherwise and would spend hours on their phones we also have xboxes and playstations with similar controls it's up to you how you do it but we did the above with the understanding that phones were a privilege not a right and that their father and i reserve the right to check through messages etc if we're worried we haven't done that for a long time

by the time i had my first phone i was going on and when i first had internet i was with the acception of having intnenet at school i think at years old she will survive and be okay with little technology in fact im super greatful for my childhood memories because i didn't need wifi or other gadgets to bring me happiness and i think your doing a good job parenting your daughter if she really wants a phone later on she can get a job when shes years old and save up for one till then she whould be a kid

my preteen has access to an xbox and a chromebook both with parent monitoring but my ex her mother got her a smartphone without consulting me despite me being the residential parent and our daughter living here most of the time it was one of those things where instead of active parenting some people just buy things for their kids ie my ex never help my daughter with schoolwork or riding a bike etc but she'll buy random devices and stuff my wife and i were pretty upset as was my ex's husband my daughter has since developed symptoms of phone addiction and a detachment from reality loss of social skills lethargic attitude about hygiene homework chores etc all that matters is being on her phone it's been an uphill battle but she's started to realize the issues and no longer resists screen time limits yes other kids have smartphones but the chat threads my daughter has been involved in with them has led to a lot of drama ie kids learning how to be keyboard warriors instead of handling problems face to face thereby inviting a lot of miscommunication and misunderstanding ironically i think it's because of this ease and submersion within text thread drama that persuaded my daughter about the merits of screen time limits so op i do not think that you are doing your child a disservice to the contrary i believe that what you are doing is much better for their mental wellbeing in the long run working in organizational psychology i've seen lots of research around the impact of smartphones on brain development and mental health remember these devices not just the apps and social media mind you but the devices themselves are built to grab one's attention and hold it in part this is what's led to the dumb phone counterculture trend

she’s gettting to the age where you can’t preserve her youth too much she’ll rebel if every kid has a phone she should have one if you can this is the age i feel does she go places without you friends houses she should have one prob

i have a and year old who both have phones and adhd though not social media my son talks to his friends on discord i don't think you're being too strict at all and if i could do so without it being such a punishment i would unring the bell of letting them both have devices though there are aspects where it's very useful maybe as she gets old enough to be going out on her own more you can give her a cheap phone to use when she's out but set up limits on it as for the social aspect it might impact her ability to build friendships but how many friends from jr high were still your primary friends in high school i wouldnt stress it too much you know what your kid needs and adhd is a bitch to manage even without an addictive dopamine machine on your person at all times

when i f was young i was never allowed to do what the other kids did in the name of protecting me it made me an outcast and i never did fit in even in high school i allow my kids to be a part of the culture that surrounds them with parental controls in place

i'm raising a child currently who is at the moment and i have these concerns i want to find the healthy balance between making her equipped and appropriately aware and able in regards to the tech if the world she's growing up in whilst also limiting how much she is consumed by tech and apps etc i don't want her to be left behind or bullied for not being on trend which we all know is a risk for our little ones anyway but also i don't want her to think that being buried in a device is healthy and normal currently she only uses tech if she's doing it with us and we have agreed she has no need for a phone for a long long time but she is a covid baby mid so she's known video calls and screens her whole life it's not affected her development she's developmentally ahead according to drs and her nursery and she's very very imaginative i duno i guess it's a really delicate line is there even a 'right answer ' who knows because i sure as shit can't find a consistent parenting strategy trend out there

the thing is the more u restrict the more sneaky they get i wasn't allowed a phone i was when i got one and only because i was walking to and from school i wasn't allowed any social media or to give out my number i didn't listen to that i got social media all under fake names so my parents wouldn't find me i had to put my phone on the charger in the loungroom every day at pm i'd uninstall all social media apps before it went on charge cause i knew my mum would look and after they went to bed i'd get up and sneak my phone when i'd get busted i'd loose my phone for a period of time so i'd just wait till my mum left the house and go through her stuff to find it

the way my cousin and her husband handled their kids access to social media is what i think is good it might not be for everyone but they set up the accounts with an email account only they had access to their kids could use social media but parents had control they could only add approved pictures add people they personally knew and it was always checked when they had been on aka daily lol well they didn't always check but say mom and dad knew they were on that day but they saw nothing they would check it out because they knew you could hide things from others i do that with my kids but they don't have anything to hide and don't resent it they would rather i check and use it than not use it at all they also do tiktok but me or dad record and post for them

i felt very excluded as a kid because my parents were weird about things that were really perfectly normal kid things i think that it’s extremely valid that too much time on those platforms is not beneficial for kids but have you thought about just letting her on them for short periods so that she has the vocabulary to discuss the things that the other kids talk about nonstop instead of just having to sit there quiet because she has no idea what they’re talking about i’m also editing to say that most kids won’t just sit there quiet they’ll start lying about stuff to sound like they fit in and their lies won’t sound realistic as they actually don’t know what they’re talking about and the kids will think she’s even weirder

i don’t think it is preserving her youth lol but it is perfectly fine that she doesn’t have a phone or specific apps my daughter has multiple friends without phones she has friends with apps she can’t have and friends that can’t have apps that she does it works just fine

my kiddo is younger but lots of her friends are already on tiktok roblox we've disallowed that along with other things like drinking soda sorry we're the parents and not ok with it we're keeping her safe

haven’t read the other comments but have you considered getting her an apple watch my daughter just started middle school and this is what she has she is still able to be a part of the text chains and call with the other girls but doesn’t have access to the apps and addictive aspects of a cell phone she also has a tablet with facetime and messenger but we’ve had to take it away because she also has adhd and impulse control and her emotions and attitude are out of control when she has access to all the apps and things on the tablet i feel that same pressure about her being left out but honestly i think in the end we are doing them a favor kids with phones do nothing but watch tik toks and obsess over things they’re too young for and don’t actually interact or play it’s also been shown that specifically for young girls that social media causes depression the longer you put that off the better

it's a difficult one and ultimately it comes down to what works for you and what you think is right for your child anything in moderation is mine and my partner's motto we allow my son a phone but there are certain lines around when and where he can use it and if he tries to abuse these there are penalties for this it's hard i would rather he didn't even have a phone at but it's the times all his friends communicate through it and we use it to keep in touch with him when he's out and about so we don't want to cut him off entirely it isn't perfect there are degrees of drama involved but we've found that trusting him he has returned this trust and the issues we occasionally have are around usage but not truthfulness which was the biggest concern we have we trust him to use it correctly and be honest if there are issues and building this trust we have found to be really important as he gets older and doesn't just view us as ogre parents who just shout no and he has to hide things from take everyone's advice but ultimately you need to make the call that you are comfortable with

my daughter has had access to roblox and tablet and she still has social anxiety giving or not won’t change much the age she’s in it’s more so that everyone else has it why would they be anxious because at any given time at school if they make a mistake every other kid has technology and they could be filmed and go viral not a lot to worry about for us but they really are in a time where its more so they’re being watched what you can do is continue to help them with having a healthy relationship with technology the biggest drawback to technology is the fact that it’s an emotional blocker it can really mess with the ability for them to learn how to navigate their emotions get mad just forget about it with a screen want to do something else it can wait go to the tablet you won’t ever regret regulating screen time but you can easily fill yourself with regret by not limiting it

i think roblox is wildly inappropriate for children i work with intellectually disabled adults that use the platform inappropriately and it has opened my eyes to the egregious nature of the game… that being said i cannot convince my stepdaughters bio parents that it’s not acceptable it’s not my decision anyway and it feels like a losing battle the internet is not a safe place for kids or tweens and this roblox thing is basically a playground for dangers of the internet and i never thought i would be the “uncool” adult to restrict my kids from things but … any parent letting their minor child in a role playing open source online community is really whacked out it’s no different than reddit

here's the thing whether you let her have tiktok now or not she's still exposed to it through her friends withholding it from her may feel safe but at the same time when she gets it she's gonna go nuts with it unless you teach her how to use it one account mom can see and a secret account she can't those of us with strict parents did that the day after we finally got a phone computer learned how to make a nd email account build trust instead maybe let her have the roblox game but she's only allowed to play in the living room when you or dad are home around like when i was a kid the big thing was to keep the family computer in the living room now everyone has a computer in their pocket so that isn't as feasible but you can still enforce similar rules you can play roblox with friends but not in secret or alone never chat with people you don't know or give personal information i'll let you have tiktok but you can not make content i'll set up your profile as private and you can follow your friends and like videos but i'll be checking who you are following and we will discuss which accounts i feel are inappropriate and if i decide you unfollow them you will do so or lose the privilege of the app i like youtube too let's make you an account and subscribe to a few fun channels a few educational ones and please come tell me if you ever see something that makes you uncomfortable and we can report it i'd prefer it if you watched youtube in the living room make sure you have her emails and passwords for them all with youtube you can log in and see her watch history sometimes things pop up if you leave a video playing and it auto plays the next so be open and say hey did you watch this you aren't in trouble i just want to talk about it because it's a bit adult and i'm uncomfortable with you viewing this sort of thing i have had to do this with my yo a lot i'll go to wash dishes while she's watching bluey on youtube and i'll hear something isn't the same and walk back in to see it changed to sirenhead attacking peppa pig's family and i switched it back to kid appropriate programming but sat down and asked was that scary are you alright with internet stuff i feel like we need to give our kids tools to know how to navigate and also be open so they come to us i'd rather my tween say hey i had some rando message me weird stuff than hide it from me in fear that i'll take their phone computer game away and meanwhile said rando is pulling out all the stops and gaslighting them with oh i scared you but don't worry i'm a friend let's just talk about school i hated math do you and then slowly earning their trust because they're naiive about how these awful people work

the world is a terrible place and keepin ur child safe from that is our jobs as parents i think it’s a great idea bc kids get so desensitized between music movies and social media these days we have to do what we must i had strict parents and hated it until i became a parent adult hearing stories that so many ppl go through i didn’t have to worry abt some of that stuff bc of my parents so keep doing you 🥳

no i don’t think you’re doing her a disservice my oldest will be in january and also has adhd she does not have a phone or ipad and i don’t see that changing anytime soon but she does have a kindle fire with parental controls enabled she hasn’t been deprived like your daughter she can call text facetime friends from my phone and she is able to play minecraft on the playstation or the computer she just isn’t allowed to use a multiplayer server her school issues everyone a chromebook so she is able to use that too but we monitor and regulate access after school and on the weekends just to ensure she’s getting her assignments done and isn’t getting distracted by other things she doesn’t have access to roblox or tiktok and her youtube access on my phone and the kindle fire is limited unfortunately it is not so limited on the chromebook and she has a tendency to doomscroll and watch content that has been questionable at times youtube has honestly been a huge issue for my kids and their access wasn’t always so limited but i’ve found that it works best for our family which is full of neurodivergent individuals to set those limits because right now they just aren’t great at creating and enforcing those boundaries for themselves— which is understandable and probably age appropriate and will hopefully improve as they grow and learn more of those skills we talk about this stuff openly and i tell her why i set these boundaries i also listen to my daughter when she feels like i’m not not being fair sometimes i agree with her and we change things up sometimes i don’t and i tell her we can’t compromise on “x” right now but let’s think of other ways i can help her feel like she has more agency control freedoms we also talk a lot about how what works for other families may not be what works for ours and that’s okay and ultimately it’s my job to keep her safe and ensure she’s accessing and using technology in age appropriate ways the school she’s at this year has hosted events before where experts come talk about how to stay safe online highlight the risks and dangers of social media etc so i plan on having her come with me when they host them this year because i think it’s important for her to be part of the bigger conversation too

in my opinion this is a bit strict i wouldn't allow tiktok regular youtube or roblox online but i would allow a phone with safeguarding restrictions i think it's important to teach kids how to safely use technology rather than banning it and ostracizing her from her peers has long term consequences on social development you can get her a phone and make it so she can't download apps and put software like bark on it to keep her safe also talk to her about the dangers if the internet make sure she feels safe coming to you with questions rather than asking google

my son is a toddler so maybe i don’t have room to talk but i used to nanny two girls one was like eight when they got a phone and had unlimited access to youtube and tiktok i watched her grow up and i can see how it negatively affected her so much of the stuff was inappropriate all she wanted to do was be on her phone it was a battle to get her to leave the house or play outside i really think all of it exacerbated her anxiety if parents are going to allow it for their young kids they need to be strict with boundaries
stay away from roblox if anything some games are extremely inappropriate disturbing and generally not child friendly topics and filters are challenging

it's a complicated and difficult beast to tackle i came of age when kids > started getting phones and thus access to social media and the likes and was one of those kids who wasn't allowed a smartphone or any social media no youtube for about four years although that decision was unrelated to the no social media one in some ways it helped me a lot i don't suffer from phone addiction and can easily recognize when it starts getting to that point in other ways it completely ostracized me in ways that severely impacted my mental health for years afterwards i'm not sure how it is now but when i was in middle high school instagram and snapchat were the only ways anybody in my grade communicated nobody used the built in text in phones because it was unequal between iphone and android i did have some friends during that time but they had no way of contacting me outside of school due to that i was never invited anywhere because it was a nightmare to try and get my old ass flip phone in a group chat without technical difficulties i was left out of everything and i had no clue what in the world anybody was talking about i'd say about of conversations were revolved around something online on those platforms youtube instagram whatever it was i had no access to it and no way of understanding any of my peers while this is my experience my mother's reasoning for not allowing me on social media seems vastly different than yours i was not allowed on these sites as a way to control me and keep me from corrupting forces strict lds family you can probably get the gist it seems as if you and your partner are coming at this from a much healthier perspective which can influence how your daughter views these restrictions i came into adulthood having dealt with control issues and manipulation as the driving forces behind these decisions your child has a good chance of coming into adulthood with a different perspective probably even positive if you are transparent on why these rules were in place

my daughters are and no phones yet they use my tablet for pinterest of course i can see the history their school banned cellphones and they have to stay in their locker i've never worried about what others thought i'm teaching my children the same i work in criminal law and have seen too many predators i compare it to leaving my children unattended on a street corner which i wouldn't but the internet is more dangerous than that in my opinion

no you are not doing her a disservice there is plenty of research to show that extended screen time social media etc directly impact kids’ mental health if i could do it over again we would not have given our foster kids who came to us at that age a phone there are so many people who prey on young and impressionable tweens even when you think you have safeguards in place we found that out the hard way and had to go through police investigations the whole nine yards as a teacher i see so many kids who do not have impulse controls when it comes to their screens they can’t put it away and then parents act shocked when kid is failing even after i’ve told them kid is on phone instead of paying attention a good middle ground is a phone like troomi it is what we use it’s a normal smartphone with special software you can enable features as you feel the kid is ready for them at its most restrictive all contacts need to be approved there is no group text pictures no internet any apps have to be approved etc and you can check every text you can also turn off texting during specific times we have had to do this with one of our teenagers it is a great tool because it allows them a chance to communicate with friends and slowly earn freedom while not giving them more than they can handle at the time

just letting you know as a young parent and i was once a year old with strict parents i mean i couldn’t even wear shorts lol my parents were so so unreasonable strict it wasn’t my mom really it was my dad saying he was protecting me blah blah what he did was isolate me made me afraid of everything and made me think anything other than what he approved of wasn’t accepted his fears became mine to process it was unfair but i wore shorts i borrowed my best friends and changed before the bell rang for class i wore the lip gloss after i got dropped off for school i wore the earrings i used myspace at my friends house i also snuck and bought my own prepaid cell phone a pre teen or teen is going to some how find a way just as i did to not be on tiktok when every one is … i mean just use the parent control i have a two year old son now and i won’t do to my son what my parents did to me… granted he’s a boy but still do you want your kid hiding things from you or having a open honest supportive authentic relationship with your child giving them access or not doesn’t determine if they are protected or not it’s being there when they need and understanding them in a time of need is the protection they need having a safe space to self express and to feel freedom knowing your there is the protection a child needs

kids with disabilities including myself electronics are horrible for i am adult know and can regulate myself but still times i have to put timers on etc you should teach her that if her homework is completed she can have min on electronics if she gets a good test score she can have more time if she does *well in school* she can have facebook yes it's weird for kids who *don't have disabilities* not to have facebook kids version or fortnite i don't allow my year old to have roblox because of the human trafficking that's been going on with it also i make sure my kid does the *talking part* with me in the room and only with his *school friends* but disability you need to communicate with his teacher and see how it *goes* when you *do try* if it becomes a *problem* stop if not keep it regulated with positive behavior gets a reward

my f experience going through middle and high school which was only a few years ago sounds a decent amount like your daughter’s my family didn’t have internet access at home no one had a laptop until i went to university i got a phone after i graduated from high school and had an ipod touch before that but without internet communication with that is useless i worked too hard in school and got some of the highest grades in my class but i had no friends and even through university and into my post school life i struggle immensely to relate to people my age because i don’t have the same context for conversations and the interests they have based around the internet like gaming or social media feel kind of frivolous to me i know they aren’t i respect people enjoying whatever they enjoy as long as it doesn’t hurt anyone but i can’t talk for minutes let alone hours about video games i don’t resent or regret how my parents raised me but i do feel like the choice they made for me will effect me for many more years than just the time i didn’t have a phone op i would suggest considering where your kid is at in respect to how well you think they can make friends in general how well they may be able to handle any of the many challenges that come with technology and what supports or bridges you can make for them

your **post** or **comment** was removed for violating the rule “no medical & legal advice” reddit and the internet in general are not the best places to get or give medical or legal advice do not ask about symptoms post pictures of symptoms injury ask if you should seek a medical professional make an appointment visit an emergency department or acute urgent care center etc do not give medical advice home remedies suggest medications or suggest medical procedures to people seeking support for a medical diagnosis do not ask if something is legal illegal whether you should call the police engage an attorney or call report to child welfare agencies always consult a professional in these matters consider looking up local helplines in your area like ask a nurse or legal aid offices for questions about this moderation reach out [through modmail] moderators rely on the community to help illuminate posts and comments that do not meet r parenting standards – please report posts and comments you feel don’t contribute to the spirit of the community **your content may have been automatically removed through auto moderation or manually removed by a human moderator it may have been removed as a direct result of your rule violation or simply as part of a larger sweep of content that no longer contributed to the original topic **

definitely this op this is not your year old's fault it's yours she's a child who is at an age where she doesn't fully grasp technology and in fact many kids her age don't get to use a tablet connected to the internet and especially not one that has credit card access you however are an adult and if you're going to let a child her age use that kind of tech then it's your responsibility to put a system in place that makes it so she can't make purchases not a system that requires \*her\* to exercise restraint but one that takes the possibility away entirely you might not be tech savvy but it's still your responsibility this isn't a teenager who should know better this is an year old whose brain may not quite get boundaries and rules and moral behavior like we'd like her to she'll grow into it i know it's frustrating as a parent especially considering your financial circumstances but you have to be careful not to confuse worry over the money with anger for your daughter children will remember your anger and tone of voice for the rest of their life and when you overreact they don't hear the lesson because all their tiny brains can focus on is the anger in your voice and the fear or shame they feel because of how you're reacting to them going forward take deep breaths go easy on her don't make a huge deal out of small mistakes especially ones that happen because she's little and doesn't really understand remember that her brain is developed enough for her to say the things you might want to hear like i understand or i'm sorry i won't do it again but at her age the emotional maturity the moral behavior the actual comprehension those things come down the road with lots of experience and hopefully gentle guidance from you

okay well i'm glad you're getting it figured out please try to keep learning don't rely on customer service reps to teach you that's not really their job especially an amazon employee trying to explain how an apple product works try to avoid using terms like kid mode and learn the actual terms for specific protections and what they mean by googling or asking questions two step verification wouldn't stop someone from making a purchase; two step verification refers to a protection that would stop someone from logging in to your account even if they learned your password your daughter didn't need to do that because you were already logged in i still think you need to consider the possibility that your daughter is the victim of a gift card scammer chatting with her and telling her to buy gift cards if that happened it's possible your daughter never even got any of the robux she tried to buy or didn't even realize she was using your account she may have thought she was just doing a favor for her friend in the game it's not super likely but there are some red flags that mean you shouldn't rule it out the fact that this happened suddenly it was a fairly elaborate scheme and it was hundreds of dollars instantly with no testing the waters makes it super suspicious you also didn't mention your daughter ever asking you to buy her robux before it would be one thing if your daughter kept asking you for robux and finally worked up the nerves to get it herself and if that's what happened then you're probably fine but if not you might be shooting yourself in the foot by punishing her for being the victim of a scammer you probably shouldn't have let her have unmonitored access to an app that lets her chat with strangers in the first place but she will interact with more people who want to take advantage of her in the future if she was being manipulated the whole thing is probably very confusing to her especially if you don't realize she was the victim of a scammer either

something i'm finding works well for encouraging balance is the one hour rule so in my house our rule is that you can spend a maximum of one hour at a time just sitting on a device after an hour you have to get up and do something else preferably something either productive or active for at least an hour before screen time is on the table again screen time is a privilege not a right of course and if you complain about the rules or use it inappropriately it can be taken away i want my kids to take away the lesson that screens should be just one of several possible options a maximum of of their free time after you take into account sleeping time chores time meal time ect works out to a very small portion of his day maybe of his day max and some days none at all because we're busy i feel that's a very reasonable amount of time to spend on screens

>she complains constantly her brothers birthday in thursday she's going to cry and whine that she's not getting anything and he gets more stuff than her what you haven't said is how you respond to complaining and whining and presumably having tantrums constantly your response to this is going to be important in well mine anyway a response draw your line make your expectations clean set boundaries then stick to them never ever cave or compromise one thing and that's it then do the one thing and nothing else don't negotiate with terrorists is my favourite term when talking about dealing with children im sorry that your early life kinda sucked; and from experience i know how that parlays into overcompensation and spoiling of one's kids but you're not doing _yourself_ or her to be honest an favours by not setting reasonable expectations and enforcing limits next time before you get her anything sit her down hey its tuesday that means we go to the store when we get there i will get you _one_ <thing she wants> but that's it until next tuesday and i mean it no tantrums no complaining and then do not under any circumstances go back on that until next tuesday if you do this two or three cycles in a row and hold to your restriction and promise then im willing to bet it goes away but during those first few cycles you're in for a rough time whining complaints im sorry i said one you got one that's it until tuesday be prepared for how you handle a tantrum my advice ignore her completely if she wants to flop on the floor and throw stuff and act like err a yr old having a tantrum ignore her i mean like make sure she doesn't hurt herself but otherwise whe she gets in your face and screams in your ear calmly turn to her and say im sorry you feel that way but you're not behaving very nicely come back to me when you're willing to behave nicely and not scream in my ear gonna be tough but it will bear fruit this will sound rather cold but i think its appropriate as a parent your job isn't to be your child's best friend if your child winds up being your best friend that's a bonus and of course im not saying not to love your child to the moon and back and show it every minute of every day but your job isn't to cater and pamper their every need and whim your job is to get them to adulthood and lead by example and part of that is learning there are rules and limits and expectations and boundaries giving them everything they want when they want isn't going to teach them to be anything but needy helpless codependent whiners edit another thing as i come back to this a few hours later you're the parent don't feel the need to ever explain or justify any rule or decision to your kids just keep it simple sorry we can't afford it what are they gonna do audit the books or no i said no that's all you need to know is no or and this actually worked with my kids yep i said so completely arbitrary reason guess what im the adult i get to make up arbitrary rules im the parent deal with it when you're the adult you get to make arbitrary rules for you kids circle of life go ask grandma and grandpa they'll tell ya the same thing they made arbitrary rules that i thought sucked when i was your age so im just passing the buck onto you < i like this one because it shows you acknowledge the unfairness i e acknowledge their pain shows _empathy_ you just don't care

maybe your daughter and yourself might benefit from spending good quality time together it sounds like your daughter is trying to get something from you she's asking for material things because you probably have given her a lot of things seeing that you feel bad you've always had trouble bonding with her so that's what she knows to ask but it might be positive to shift the perspective and give more importance to time spent together etc maybe also to tell her why you appreciate and love her as a person why she is valuable and slowly start shifting the narrative you have that you can only provide things and that she needs those things my interpretation might be a stretch and of you don't recognize yourself in it please ignore my comment you don't really say enough to make such assumptions but something told me it might be part of what's going on and with many people commenting saying you need to tell her no and she must learn i think it's also important that you learn how to give differently i don't think a child that age is responsible for behaving that way and i think there's no need to blame anyone but rather to change what can be changed hopefully for the best good luck

i totally agree with the others about not giving in to the tantrums however one 'positive parenting' technique that always helped a bit with my son was sort of acknowledging the wishes for things he wanted to do or buy and even expanding on them into silly fantasy 'yeah that would be awesome huh it'd be fun to stay at the playground and slide all night long even until tomorrow or maybe live at the the playground where would you sleep ' and taking pictures of items he liked in stores 'we aren't buying anything today but do you want me to take a picture of it that would be cool to have huh it'd be fun if we bought every single toy in the store but then we wouldn't have room to walk in our house ' but if he was deciding to be stubborn and tantrum about it then it was just go sit outside the store for a few minutes until he calmed down also your daughter doesn't need to know about your money situation it'll sound like too much money if you have a lot and it'll stress her out too much if you don't have enough and you don't need to justify your decisions to her based on finances you're the mom and you just get to decide what you want to do

no complaining allowed shut it down at the first complaint this means consistency stop whatever is happening and make it abundantly clear tantrums need to be addressed immediately and it could mean abruptly going to the car until she’s ready to stop causing a scene teaching breathing exercises to help her control her emotions is helpful expressing emotions is ok but she needs to know there is a time place and appropriate way to do so it sounds like a lot for her age but children are smart resilient and react well to firm consistent behavior by adults i’ve raised three and these tactics worked even for stubborn kids she needs to know that she doesn’t get gifts when it isn’t her birthday or celebration it’s important she understands it now the more you reiterate it without feeding into the drama she will learn consistency consistency consistency even when it’s inconvenient or you don’t feel like it if you don’t she will learn that she can wear you down good luck

i think you’ve gotten a ton of great advice with either sticking to no or giving an allowance something to add though i’d start being unfair it sounds mean i know i’ve done this with my kids and now as teens older children it’s served them well what i mean by this is basically if i’m out shopping without kids and see something i like for kid i buy it for just the one kid and give it to them in front of the others next time i grab something for someone else and repeat over time my mantra is “life isn’t fair and i wouldn’t be doing you any favours raising you to think it ever is what goes around always comes back around and you will get your turn soon ” this way my kids don’t expect to get something when others get something they don’t get sad at bday parties they don’t have a false sense of entitlement they’re genuinely happy for each other when they get something cool this takes time and patience and possibly tears in the beginning but it’s well worth it

i understand i have a complainer as a daughter she's and has gotten better but she still whines i have learned the power of headphones and ignore drives her nuts she knows onces i sit down on the couch and put them on she has lost all hope now this didn't happen over night this took many many days of trail and error try things out you will find what works once it clicks you will be like that worked wow sorry about your start i had it bad too abusive parents i swore i was going to be the opposite of them so far so good i don't yell no physical punishment and we do things in my house different you need to find your way keep a small notebook take notes write some stuff down we broke that cycle it's time to start fresh raise our kids with no fear of their moms we can do this i believe in you make time for just you and your daughter you and her coloring together watch her favorite movie together or her favorite tv show you and her do stuff together also before you go into any store give this a try okay we are going into the store to get a d c b we are not getting toys or junk food or this or that do not ask the answer will be no i still do this with my kids ànd they are and good luck you can do this i believe in you

there's a book how to talk so kids will listen there are ways to say no without saying no maybe you can give her month for digital content she gets it on the first of the month meanwhile she can use a journal to write down the ones she likes if my son complained about another's birthday gifts i would suggest he start making some plans for his birthday or pick a school end present or a christmas present etc or i would remind him of something nice he's got coming his way like a playdate with a friend i tell my son beforehand not to expect a toy when we go to the store if he really likes something then i take a picture of it i have followed up so he does trust me for example he likes the model toy car displays at the pharmacy and we do sometimes have to go so i took a picture of one when with him but then bought it and gave it to him a couple weeks later when he got his report card it is a simple thing but i want him to be acknowledged and also to look forward with hope and also to be proud of the things he accomplishes i too am very annoyed when my son asks for stuff but it is normal i don't give in but i feel almost hurt when he keeps asking like he just doesn't appreciate me or our home i try to put aside the feeling and i have lots of techniques for saying no delaying gratification or setting limits

we have a rule for stores we only buy what’s on the list period no exceptions we review the list together before going in and my kid gets a job of finding a couple things on the list then there’s no arguments in the store and if my kid asks for something i have the boundary to refer to

we actually consider just going to the toys section of a store to be a privilege let alone getting something that privilege was revoked if there was bad behavior tantrums or constant whining was considered bad behavior and the privilege had to be earned back to go to that area by handling at least trip or more not going to see the toys also his most common purchase was legos so his allowance was st set so he would have to save for weeks to get the smaller set of legos that way he was encouraged to plan ahead and save and not just spend i also specifically answered whining with a calm tone saying “i will not reward that tone you need to talk to me politely to continue this conversation” i had to repeat that alot along with rewarding good behavior and specifically calling out not whining “thank you for using your polite words i like helping you when you use nice words”

we went through this my wife was going out though divorce with her previous husband and working a lot so she spoiled her daughter out of guilt every day when we picked her up from grandmas she ask where her toy surprise was we weaned her off of it with very small things and then only occasionally and then none at all there was a lot of whining and crying and we were both scared she was permanently spoiled but eventually she got over it we talked to her about why we don’t get toys all the time about money all that you can get past this with her it’s just gonna require you to be firm and patient through her meltdowns about it try planning activities to do together to replace that space in the relationship with something more healthy and meaningful

my almost year old has been like this for about a year too i think it’s just the age they are testing their powers but also still lack the empathy self awareness etc to know that it’s not appropriate they obviously don’t have a good grasp on budgeting either 😂 we just try to stay firm but empathetic and we give him little opportunities to earn money by doing extra chores etc so can start understanding what it’s like to save up money for something he wants most of the time he ends up having fun doing chores and getting caught up in that stuff that it ends up being a good distraction it’s not useful as far as saving us work because he doesn’t do a great job but he likes to try to use the vacuum or spray and wipe things or use a duster so it keeps him occupied we still tend to spoil him a bit especially during covid and being stuck at home more but we’re working on it and he’s starting to catch on

as far as i read here on reddit this is a common problem now on school nip it the bud maybe this approach is worth a try put on your very worried voice and say oh no are you feeling ill are you in pain this moaning means either s*x or pain you are much too young for s*x so you must be really ill lead the child to his bed tuck him in close the curtains and take away all electronics with the words if you are so ill you really have to rest you stay in bed for today just rest for all meals bring him a bowl of intact chicken broth it is so good for an upset body don't give in to any responses always answer the moaning sounded so bad i am not taking any chances the next morning ask him if he feels better and wants to get up again tell him you will take moaning very seriously from now on moaning means illness if it continues you will take him to a doctor if this is a joke he will pay for any treatment tell him i will not allow underage s*x in my home if you make these moans when you are with a friend said friend will leave i will contact the teacher and if you moan in her class i will kut you in bed without electronics and lights out for days we will squash this horrible illness whether it is on purpose or not he is only so you could just omit some parts of these sentences the s*x parts because of age my son was when he had a short problem phase so reactions differ

am i a bad father i'll try to make this brief i have a year old son from a out of wedlock birth the mother and i have not been together for years i love on the other side of the country and i'm active duty military but let's not make the military a determining factor i pay child support and have visitation i get my son every spring break week every summer days every thanksgiving days and every odd christmas about weeks he has his own phone and calls me whenever he wants we don't talk everyday but at a minimum i try to make sure i call times a week we only video call so we can always see each other when we do talk on the phone it can range from mins quick good morning good night before bed to hours watching a show together or me watching him play roblox or us playing a game together we occasionally play phone tag due to my work schedule and his school schedule and most times i get off when he's about to go to bed and i sometimes miss my call window so i try to stick to calling on the weekends and days he's out of school the mother thinks i need to do more as a father like visit on unscheduled days like presidents day weekend for example the way i see it with the allowed pto leave time flight drive time cost for commute and lodging to do all of that just for a weekend doesn't exactly seem logical to me when instead i can save all the leave time and funds for my designated time i love my son very very much and i feel that i'm doing what i can when he's with me we do everything under the sun and he enjoys his time and so do i my son loves me and takes every chance to be around or something with me we play video games together we ride bikes together and talk about deep sea creatures and anime together which is something i know he loves b c he doesn't get that type of interaction at his house it's explained to me that i'm doing the bare minimum what more can i do at my distance am i a bad father

it sounds like mom is saying you are welcome to be more involved my husband had more down days in the military than i did when working full time and would go see family on those if you and him have a weekend that converges why not fly him out

put your child's mother's opinion aside for a moment because it feels like her opinion has put you in defensive mode simply ask yourself what kind of father you want to be is the arrangement you have enough for you is it enough for your son recognize that minute phone calls days week might start to decrease as he becomes a busy teenager your son being raised by an overwhelmed single working mother also impacts him and the outcomes that he will have in life his mother saying she needs more from you is a reflection of the amount of parental attention and support your son is receiving if you think what you're doing is not enough decide how you want to change your life to be more involved doing nothing is also a choice in the long run it isn't your child's mother you will have to defend your actions to it will be to your son and yourself

it truly does not matter whether an internet stranger thinks you are a good or bad father your child's other parent says you are doing the bare minimum she is the person who is actually coparenting with you i think she's in a much better position to know than us whenever a parent pulls out a phrase like the bare minimum they are telling you something important they are telling you that they're drowning forget whether or not you are a good dad or a bad dad that's not relevant right now your son's mother is drowning are you going to do anything about it or are you going to continue to pout because you don't want to ruin your image as a good dad

by your count you are parenting days out of a day year and calling less than half the week fact is you are a mostly absent father my siblings and i had a dad like that and that's just not enough time for you to be embedded in a kid's life the way a present dad is my brother was angry and would just complain about the travel time to see him and having to give up home time or time with friends to see him just to basically have everyone get to know each other over again every time i always wanted the limited time i had with my dad to be perfect so i was usually disappointed it also made me never talk about anything serious or deeply personal in my life because i didn't want to waste our fun time on being vulnerable or uncomfortable so our relationship became pretty shallow as i got older we never made up that ground in adulthood because he died somewhat suddenly

hey i'm your kid in the future growing up i only saw my dad for christmas summer and thanksgiving break we didn't have video calling and i don't honestly remember talking on the phone with him every week because he was a long haul truck driver i love my dad i always have our bond is good because like yall when we were together the time spent was very present and heartfelt as an adult with my own kids i question why he didn't call more often and play an active role in my day to day life not so much why didn't he visit more often my advice text him every day even if he doesn't respond and give him a glimpse into your life send random pics to let him know you're thinking of him a quick good morning and look starbucks has their christmas cookies out i'm sending your mom so yall can get some after school or ask him for his favorite songs so you can listen to them while you do stuff

my son's father moved to the other side of the country months ago he didn't have to he chose to i as the mom now operate basically on the same schedule as you dad has part of summer and alternating christmases and spring break he calls or texts approximately once a week my son has a phone and can call his dad anytime but he doesn't because his dad doesn't know anything about what's going on in his life because it's obvious he doesn't care you call him twice a week mostly on the weekends during what is likely his and his mom's only free time way to go dad what's the name of your kids teacher who is his best friend you pay child support is it enough do you even care have you ever asked or is it just the state guideline what does a school lunch cost or does his mom pack a lunch for him every day when was his last dentist appointment and when's his next one and are there any issues you should be watching for does he have enough properly fitting socks and underwear winter is coming does he need a coat what was hard at school for him today what was the last thing his mom had to punish him for does he need shoes do you know what size his feet are what's his favorite podcast right now is his mom experiencing any extreme life stresses where she could just really use from freaking help pretend you have to feed yourself and someone else three square meals a day every single day this and a million other things are what his mom is doing every single day all these people telling you that you are a great dad aren't parents or are just trying to be nice you aren't necessarily a bad dad you don't hit him it doesn't sound like but in no way are you a great dad find out the answers to all the questions i posed above and then stay current on them doordash your kid a meal so maybe mom doesn't have to cook for once because supporting mom even if you aren't in a relationship is part of being a good parent find out when the next parent teacher conference is and ask if you can attend via zoom spend time with him when you aren't doing everything under the sun make him bored and then deal with him you sound profoundly unaware of what parenting actually consists of

parenting… getting them off to school the bedtime routine taking them to extracurriculars and the fun parent gets so much credit because they don’t have to do any of the discipline i don’t think one more weekend of the year will make much of a difference in your relationship with your child mom might be jealous that you get it so easy you don’t put in any of the thankless daily labor yet you get all the credit for being the “fun parent” that would probably be how i’d feel the money and “logic” is not the right approach to this situation kids see who is there i resented my mom for a lot of years and we had to work on our relationship to repair things my brother never went through that he always adored my mom and still does but he was a little younger when everything went down your relationship might be fine with your son and if you’re okay with seeing him less than months of the year that’s your business my only suggestion is that you keep tabs on your relationship if he starts making passive aggressive remarks then what you’re doing now might not be working sometimes as kids get older they start viewing the situation differently make sure that you and mom don’t speak poorly of each other in front of your son you sound like a decent dad your son will have good memories of you two playing together i would encourage you to find a way to live closer to your kid you’re not married to the military your son is your blood and you will never get these years back i hope you want to be more involved because as a parent your role extends beyond wallet and playmate you’re more like a “cool uncle” right now in your level of involvement i’m glad that you want to have a good relationship with your son but parental duties are more than that what do you want to teach him what values do you want him to adopt how can you guide him through tough situations

yeah you don't prioritize your kid and he knows that so does everyone else there are worse fathers in the world but imo it would be hard for me to respect a man that doesn't have his kid at least of the time barring some kind of extenuating circumstance like deployment or a some kind of medical condition or something many people change careers move cities or countries rearrange living situations i mean really go to the ends of the earth to be present in their kids' day to day lives so it's just about how much effort you want to put into it is your kid happy

this is a tough question and i guess that as you are asking you have reflected on your situation and are wondering if perhaps you are so the following is built on that premise you still need to work and live your life your needs wants and desires are important and no kid needs a parent that that blames the child for ruining their lives is there any reason your home base can’t be in the same city as your son noting i am aware military families often move around if you seriously want to be a dad and actually participate in your kids life then yes you should be spending every moment you can with the kid the kid is probably happy now but as he matures and goes through puberty not having you there is likely to be an issue for him i had to leave my state when my kids were mid teens for a couple of years it definitely changed the dynamic of the relationship i had with them if you truely want to be a father you also need to be talking to the mother as often as you can co parenting is tough damn parenting in general is tough but the mum is living with your son and will have insights into what is going on in his life that you just won’t have if you are serious be a parent and not just an adult friend your job is to help your kid be the best person they can be sometimes that means making hard choices in my opinion the relationship you’re describing with your son would probably best be categorised as an “uncle” type relationship you’re an adult in his life that has an impact on the type of person he grows up to be i put it that way because it sounds like you get to be the “friend” and have all the fun times but you most likely aren’t in the position where you’ll be the first person he goes to when he has a problem not saying what you are currently doing is wrong or that it will screw your kid up if it’s enough for you then go with it ultimately it’s your decision but as with all decisions choices you make don’t half arse it and make sure when you look back you can say “i did the right thing”

how long is your enlistment yrs have you been in the army his entire life do you plan on staying enlisted until retirement there will be times when life makes it necessary to physically be away from our kids that alone doesn't make you a bad parent but just cause you're calling and spending vacation time sure as hell doesn't make you a good one if you aren't going to change your life or lifestyle you just have to sort of accept you're not a great dad don't think you're a hero for what you're doing be honest with yourself some people have lives or traumas or finances or whatever that make them not great people it sucks that they hurt people along the way it sucks that you have missed out on a lot of important moments and a lot of unimportant ones it sucks that he will most likely always ache for you but that's been done you weren't a great dad you can acknowledge that you're doing the best you can and you aren't a good dad and you can still be a good and worthy person but moving forward what are you going to do what are you capable of and what's feasible are you okay with acknowledging this are you ready for the hard conversations when he's old enough to ask questions how will you feel far in the future having a son who you only know about on holidays

surprised i haven’t seen the term “disneyland dad” thrown around here basically the fun superficial dad it’s good while they are young but when they get older they start to see it for what it is i do believe unfortunately your ex is right and it is bare minimum there is so much involved in raising a child you’re missing it i am sad for you but also sad for your son when he grows and has his own family he will discover how much you weren’t there your relationship will always be this way unless you choose to do more during his formative years you don’t have enough “credit in the account” to make it through the constant emotional withdrawals that come with having a teenager teenagers are rebellious stubborn angsty argumentative etc you trying to “parent” or discipline him when he gets into this stage will likely feel laughable to him like you’re choosing to parent now when you have chosen not to their whole life i say this as someone who had a mostly phone conversation and some weekends and holidays with a parent it will feel like oh now you want to show up and unfortunately i still get the ick from this parent even though we do have a decent relationship as an adult their affection and desire to be involved in my life now feels gross and unnatural to me and i am a grown woman in my mid s when things get tough he is going to turn to his mom his whole life and when you’re old that may hurt your ego and you may wish you did things differently but it will be too late it’s great you are being reflective there’s a lot of good advice here and also a lot of excuses as to why it’s fine to continue the way you are

i had a dad exactly like this and we have a super awkward and not close relationship now when we do talk it’s fine but i also have a son and i can’t imagine only seeing him a handful of times a year i feel like i barely know my dad he feels like any other distant family member i often wonder what my relationship with my dad would look like now if he had come around more he’s not a bad guy at all but he was the most proactive luckily i had a great stepdad who was there who became a strong father figure so i don’t consider myself a girl with daddy issues no hate to you you seem like you want to do more and are willing to but i’d jump on it now before he becomes a teenager and wants to spend his summers doing other stuff good luck

i think you're doing the best you can due to your circumstance when you are out of the military just truly be there for your son some people use the military as an excuse of not having enough time and getting out of parenting it doesn't sound like you are so just prove that you're fully there for him as soon as you're out

i’m sorry you’re in the military and i’m sorry you’re an absent father because the military has you living so far away from your son it’s your choice if you find work close to your son spend more time with him and become an active part of his life you don’t have to of course but there are consequences to that choice

you are not a bad father my dad also military lived in virginia japan and even miles away from me after him a my mom got divorced when he lived in japan he complained that he had to pay for half of my ticket to visit him when he lived miles away i didn’t even know me and my sister saw him driving down the street and we followed him home that’s how we found out he never tried to see us or invite us over on my th bday he called my mom to tell her he was taking her back to court so he could get his child support lowered she asked if he wanted to talk to me happy bday and he said no she asked if he was coming to my graduation the next day and he said he wasn’t planning on it because he didn’t know if i was graduating i got a college scholarship so that was a bs excuse that’s what a bad father looks like

active duty parent here no taking leave to show up for an unscheduled visit is an unreasonable ask do you want to revisit the custody agreement and become the primary parent except for work ups deployments lots of single parents in the military just gotta get a good family care plan in order — au pairs are popular but at the military considers him old enough to be a latchkey kid he gets an id card and can wander around base with his bike to the preteen center the playground etc
