not a bad father i’m now and my mom was active duty for + years her and my dad were divorced and i lived with my dad as a kid i wondered why she wasn’t around as much but as an adult i realized she was stationed miles away and when you’re military you have certain responsibilities to the government hopefully he grows up and understands this best thing you can do is keep in contact ad much as possible calls texts etc try and visit if you can on non scheduled days most military children end up eventually understanding the reality of the parents situation and that they wanted to be there but physically couldn’t

i would say the fact that you're even querying whether you should try and do more is indicative of you should be if you have capacity to do more for your child the answer is always yes as far as your circumstance allows however i wouldn't pay too much mind to what the mother is saying in this circumstance since realistically she's considering it from her perspective of being the majority custody partner and is through that having more direct involvement there are plenty of fathers who work fifo or far away who have more than enough involvement for healthy development of a child life isn't as black and white as people make it out to be in these scenarios im new to being a parent but the main thing i've learned is no matter what you do some idiot is going to tell you you're wrong for doing it if your ex and yourself aren't on amicable terms she's always going to find something wrong with what you're doing and even if you are parenting approaches and balancing it with realities of life are such polarised views that she'll more than likely have criticisms anyway do the best you can with what you have also ignore the comments about clearing things with the mum to avoid being viewed as the fun parent the time you have with him due to your working circumstance is limited and wanting them to enjoy their time with you as much as possible isn't wrong when your child grows up they're not going to be sitting there thinking about how one parent was funner than the other no one sits there dwelling like that it's all just creating memories and anything you can do to make his childhood memories more positive is never a bad thing

i don’t think you’re a bad dad what your focus should be is closing the distance between you two i would not renew your contract and then set your life up where your son is in the mean time i would send daily texts facetime for events and have remote teacher conferences so you can be more ‘hands on’ etc care packages and hand written letters seems like a great idea and even one of those lamps that you touch and it alerts your son
you’re not a bad father and most non military families won’t understand your schedule or how leave works you’re doing the best you can

i’m not a service member but i am married to one i can completely understand where you’re coming from with the holidays unless you live relatively close because getting flights etc approved can be like jumping through hoops or it not even getting approved especially if you have a crappy command i also know that the military does like to make last minute changes and the pay isn’t absolutely incredible so wanting to save and be prepared for when he does visit to make it as memorable is completely understandable it’s not like you can just up and move either you’re required by orders to be at a specific location and i think alot of people forget about that and you may not be given the option to choose where that location is i think you’re being as involved as you can be i’d just say take every opportunity to call when you can maybe send him a little care package or something of his favorite snacks the two of you enjoy sharing or some of his favorite little knick knacks to show you’re thinking of him and remember those are his favorite things you can’t be faulted because you have a contracted obligation to a job that you can’t just call out of like others can while it may seem to others like you’re doing the bare minimum i feel like you’re doing the most you can at the end of the day as long as you and your son have a great relationship that’s all that matters edited to fix a sentence mistake

i am not military but i think this is helpful information also i’m surprised no one has said it or as far as i have seen what about asking your son what he wants keeping in mind that if he wants to move to be with you that you are willing and able to provide that opportunity for him also for what it is worth i think you are a good father just for asking the question you obviously care enough to put yourself out there for complete strangers to assess i would encourage you to communicate with mom and find out why this is coming up if she has been fine with the arrangements thus far maybe there is something else going on with her communication is the only way to have any sort of relationship whether it be parenting or coparenting i would say that it basically boils down to what you can live with even if you are not physically present there are ways to be there for your child most schools have electronic ways of communicating with parents are you able to receive the day to day school information like maybe if there are field trips or something you can arrange to help out in some way providing lunch or something if there are discipline issues you could help to navigate that be there by video for the tough questions maybe help out with homework when or if possible i would encourage you to try and have the best coparenting relationship in order to be as present as possible maybe it is something as simple as y’all ordering or making the same meal and eating together via video chat on a week night i don’t presume to know you or your life i can’t say what your priorities are but you know you know your priorities and your integrity that is what it boils down to are you the type of father that makes your son proud are you proud of the type of father you are these are just some things to think about in closing i commend you for caring enough to ask the hard questions i thank you for your sacrifice for our country i truly wish you well

please be careful and talk with your attorney first about the terms in your parenting plan i have seen judges reprimand parents for showing up during the other parent’s parenting time if mother has “uninterrupted time” specified in the parenting plan that generally means parent time exercised by one parent without interruption by the presence of the other parent i don’t know the terms of your parenting plan and this is not legal advice but i personally would not just show up without getting approval from the other parent in writing each and every time please consult with an attorney first

as someone with both parents in the military and extremely involved maternal grandparents… i would note that the time you listed is mostly the “fun time” spring break summer etc you’re not doing any of the most difficult showing up of life homework sick days cleaning cooking healthy meals lunch packing taking him to extracurricular etc you’re not a “bad father” you’re just absent for a lot of the day to day grind he might not notice it now although he might but he definitely will as he gets older he’ll want your presence at his sports games concerts etc life is the day to day not just the big moments as he becomes a teenager it will be more difficult to overcome arguments because he can simply hang up i mostly remember my parents not showing up and they definitely were there for the “big stuff”… but honestly as an adult it was the cinnamon toast when i was sick from my grandma that i miss or my grandpa teaching me to ride a bike i love my parents deeply but hands down it’s the day to day i live on the other side of the world now and don’t visit that often just for the fun times… but i know it’s the day to day that counts and it’s really sad he will only be a child for a few more years if you can be local it would probably create a stronger foundation

she is a bit right you are the fun casual parent and it’s more a fun uncle or grandparent type relationship you aren’t there for the homework teaching basic life skills his physical care picking him up from school getting him ready in the mornings you generally aren’t there when he’s sick caring for him having to take time off work and getting sick yourself and still looking after him and stressing about the impact on bills you aren’t buying his friends birthday presents and ferrying him to his friends house and sport and school events you aren’t trying to figure out how to see your friends because you have a child alone with you full time you aren’t researching schools and managing his education while you have a relationship and that’s good it’s barely a parenting type relationship with all the mundane responsibilities you talk about saving your leave for him what about his mother she has to juggle work and caring for him full time and you baulk at the mere suggestion that you may have to do the same or make sacrifices and career change to accommodate actually parenting your child that makes you a bit crappy to be honest you are an absent father more than a crap one

as a mother who was a single working mom for years before i met my husband i will say you are doing x more than my ex ever did but you’re not doing enough all i hear you saying is “i have fun with my child” riding bikes video games conversation etc these are all important aspects of parenting and critical to bond with our children but only scratches the surface you’re his buddy not his father do you make sure he does his homework participate in discipline enforce his chores make sure his hygiene is taken care of you are a “when i have time” parent that is a problem in my opinion
i just want to pop in real quick to say i admire and am proud of your candid reflection and i think because you care you're going to be the dad you want to be take care fellow dad 🤜💥🤛

can you move closer it sounds like you have fun periodic visits with your son and make an effort to call that's great but to have a real day to day relationship on the ins and outs and logistics of his life you need to be nearby talk to your ex and refer to your custody agreement she may also need a break with all the laundry and drs appointments and homework and school drama etc things will also change as he enters teenagerhood and having his father around would make a significant difference in terms of a regular male role model

having a sailor dad that was absent when i was a kid he has made up for it since he retired it was all he could do he was on a ship but he has made up for it now he is retired maybe keep that in mind for once you are done with the military it sucks you can't be there for the day to day but sometimes that's just the way it is i was confused about it when i was a kid and wished he was around more but now that i'm grown and have a family of my own i understand

my husband is active military we are still together and he lives here but he does leave frequently for periods of time air force he calls and talks to our daughter every night that he can when he is gone even if it is just a hello how was your day i love you very much i miss you so much i cant wait to see you goodnight she is excited to talk to him and see him and tell him about her day are you actively pursuing a posting closer to your son as well im sure you would take it up if it was offered but are you actively pursuing a way to make it possible can you remuster without causing too much strife to a position that allows you a posting closer are there career options that while not the most ideal for you personally would allow you to see your son more often do you have transferable skills to a job outside the realm of the military that would allow you to be closer to your son why is being in the military outside of a contract time period more important than the time you can spend with your son if you are able to remove yourself from it and still maintain a healthy life there's lots of questions here that can be looked at in terms of what you are willing to do to be a better father if not i would say that you are severely limiting your capacity to be the father your son needs wants i give you credit for how much you do do in comparison but that is also like a low bar when we look at the amount of fathers parents who are entirely absent from their children's lives the minimum should be more than you are doing but sadly it isn't seen that way so you doing what you are can be seen in a positive way i don't think you are a bad father by any means because i can tell you do care but i think there is always more that can be done
will your son think so depending on how long it takes he won’t be a kid much longer by the teen years it’s hard to start to be present then my own father tried that and for me it was too late

if your goal is to be a father and just an overall good parent i think you should be working towards being closer to your child more often having my dad around during planned visits or going to his house for the summer or whatever it was like visiting a relative we did fun stuff he lived in florida we always went to theme parks and stuff it was an event in the most ideal situation parents are there most of the time they're available and present in the mundane times and during the exciting times they provide a kind of consistent stability of being there to guide and to reassure and to comfort and to seek care from that kind of attachment is really important and again i don't think you can really form that kind of attachment with the way your setup is currently when i was a kid i wanted my dad around i just wanted him there i missed him i wanted to share my life with him like i could with my mom my life was where i was when i went to where he was it wasn't the same nothing was mine nothing felt like mine again it was like going on a vacation what if i had a hard day and just needed someone to be with me can a video call replace that i don't know we didn't have that when i was a kid it wouldn't give me a chance to have my friends know my dad though or take me somewhere after school to be comforted like if you were there think about how many opportunities you would have for connection which are impossible the way things are as a parent sometimes the little things make the biggest difference how connected do you want to be with your child if you really want to be connected you need to be closer more often

i think the distance is really the kicker here you sound like you're doing the best you can and as someone who grew up with my dad only minutes away but completely out of communication i'm going to say i think it's awesome you call frequently and awesome that you commit to your schedule this stuff is so important and helps your son feel loved and supported and that is super important the flip side of this equation is that mom may be feeling a lot of stress you get your son during his down vacation time mostly so the brunt of the work is still likely falling on her and she may be feeling frustrated by that things like helping with homework every day teacher conferences keeping up with after school activities getting kiddo to birthday parties and keeping up with all that that's likely mostly on her and it gets really tiring especially if she feels like she ever has to be the strict scheduler manager or bad guy in terms of schoolwork or discipline there's a very real phenomenon of the disney dad mom has to be the disciplinarian and taskmaster then dad shows up for vacation time and everyone just has fun i would suggest if you haven't already really looking over how things are working to make sure you've got some of the less fun stuff too when you call over the week are you helping him with or looking over his homework when he's visiting you over the summer are there teams he can play on or music lessons or whatever that he can do while with you so you're handling some of that stuff too are you able to meet his teachers and do virtual conferences with them etc it may be you're doing a lot of this too i don't know the full brunt from your post but it's something to keep in mind i can tell you really want to do the best you can and you are already making sure you are connected to your son and love him very much and your ex may always be biased in this regard i just wanted to bring up this dynamic so you can pay attention and make sure you're not slipping into it

oh i'm certainly not going to argue that he's an *equal* parent to his child's mother that's a given she's doing all of the heavy lifting and i'm willing to bet that what she said to op came largely from a place of being burnt out as a solo parent and rightfully so but a lot of the things you listed certainly can be done over the phone facetime or during the custody time dad has it might not help the mother with the big stuff to the extent anyone would like but it's still being a father to the child independent of the parenting dynamic and again is it as good or perfect no but to say it can't be done just isn't true and is the only way some parents can *be* parents in their respective circumstances not being the primary parent doesn't make someone a bad or not good parent

honestly i’ve seen this type of obsession in other kids i’ve worked with and unfortunately for them nothing else can compare to video games for some kids games are all consuming i would either a remove the games completely many people find when they remove technology their kids zest for life returns i would be pretty concerned if my child was so obsessed with just one thing and didn’t find interest in literally anything else it may be that games are just too addictive for him or b not allow him to play them until his work is done if he talks about it instead of focusing then you walk away and leave him with his worksheet book activity etc he needs to know exactly what he needs to complete and be able to check it off so he understands how much work is left until he can play games if he doesn’t finish his work in a day then no games that day be consistent or this will never work he should also have a set time schedule for when he plays games and watches those videos with the understanding that trying to do them when it’s not time results in loss of privileges lastly could he be on the spectrum fixated interests can be an indicator of asd if this is a concern you should get him evaluated

jamie glowacki calls it “uh huh parenting” and suggests that it perpetuates the problem her strategy recommendation is to focus on deep connection times together when you’re fully immersed in whatever you’re doing together with firm boundaries around not touching your phone or anything else and then pulling away clearly for your own time and holding a firm boundary for that time as well i learned this strategy from her podcast oh crap i love my toddler but holy fuck and i’ve been using it successfully for two years now it’s not an overnight process but it was definitely worth the effort because my kid rarely does this anymore and when he does it’s usually a sign that i haven’t been focusing enough on our connection times a little extra focus fills his cup back up and then he’s off to play on his own again

i think it’s absolutely ok to set the boundary of having quiet time and not wanting someone to talk to you my son is a talker to the extreme i value that it has led to some awesome conversations between us but i do a few things that i think helps me maintain sanity if he’s talking about something i’m not interested in or talking just to hear himself talk i try to give him my full attention for a few minutes if i’m half listening i find he talks more and more because he’s trying to get my attention if i give it he usually gets to the point or realizes he doesn’t have anything else to say his need for attention is satisfied and he stops if he doesn’t i find a stopping point and say “thank you for telling me about that i would like to have some quiet time right now but we can talk more later ” reminders about what a conversation is sometimes kids talk us about things we aren’t interested in and it’s important to listen that said kids need to be taught that a conversation is a back and forth conversation you need to have room to give input or ask questions “that’s interesting; so what do you like about that dinosaur ” if they aren’t giving you that room it’s not a conversation in a similar thread they need to learn that while you value their interests you may not share them my son learned this the hard way when he kept asking me what my favorite sport car was and i kept responding “i don’t know any thing about sport cars and i don’t care to ever own one i respect that you are interested in them please respect that i’m not ” anyway these things have helped us have more conversations and fewer “i’m being talked at and i’m dying inside” moments

this is tough because middle schoolers care so much about what other kids think of them he probably feels scared and embarrassed because they were making fun of him especially since they're girls and he's probably hitting puberty and starting to care about what girls think of him did your son know that these were fake converse shoes or did you tell him they were real from the way you wrote it it sounds like he knew they were fake and didn't care until the girls made fun of him for it have a conversation with your son talk about his feelings and fears that he might have for example being ostracized and laughed at by the whole school comfort him and try to take away some of his fears middle school really is a social minefield and stuff like this can definitely lead to kids losing their friends or being made fun of which is what makes it so difficult if this happens to you as an adult you can kind of tell yourself oh they'll forget about it because they will but when you're and all you care about is what other kids think of you it's so much harder if you can't afford real converse you don't have to buy them i think it's better to go for generic clothes shoes than to buy fakes though because when you wear fakes you're trying to make people believe you're wearing the real thing which is what makes it so bad in these kids' eyes they will probably care less if he just wears shoes from unknown brands but of course your son probably won't like that i think you should be honest with him and tell him that even though you know it's important to him and he wants to fit in you just can't afford it this year you can also try to buy used items of clothing since you can usually get name brand clothing for a fraction of the original price that way i know it sounds a little disgusting to buy used shoes but i'm sure if you sanitize them properly it's all good start having conversations with your son about what types of things are important in life because the truth is if these girls care that much about a fucking star on an overpriced piece of cloth they are superficial and of course they're probably superficial because they're also and terrified of being ostracized for minor social transgressions but it's still true that caring about someone else's clothes is superficial your son needs to understand that there are many things about him that are much more important than his clothes or shoes and he should focus on those if he wants to find real friends that care about him as a person and are there for him try to help him strengthen his confidence does he have any extracurriculars that he's good at and or cares about that's what really helped my son who is now and was also very insecure when he was around your son's age maybe there's someone in your son's life who can teach him how to respond to mean comments kids often respect other kids who seem like they don't give a shit and can come up with witty responses to teasing of course that's easier said than done and you can't really fake confidence when you don't feel confident at all in this situation it's really tough

your edit is a very kind approach and for him to follow through with you on that will develop his maturity when you talk to him about his own confidence point out how immature those girls are let him know that people close to them probably put them down and that it’s really sad they don’t have anyone mature enough in their lives to show them how wrong it is to do that let him know that one day when he’s a grown person he’ll look back and see what spoiled hearts they have and how immature and stupid it is to be that way it may help him to transition from embarrassment to pity for them it’s a pitiful thing when a kid doesn’t have anyone with character in their lives and when a kid’s social currency requires them to make their hearts ugly they sold their compassion for cheap acceptance that may resonate with your son if he hears about kids being picked on for their clothes and stuff ask him to find that kid later and compliment the thing they were picked on perhaps he can put some kindness in someone else’s life when they’re feeling low so they can continue to enjoy the things they love and appreciate with confidence

background due to some unfortunate circumstances my year old niece is now under my care full time i am very new to all of this a couple months ago i noticed some strangers pop up on her facebook messenger app and asked her about it she admitted to not knowing these people irl and that she just randomly added them on facebook we had great discussions about internet safety removed everyone she didn't personally know and i had high hopes we were all good we weren't the next incident occurred about a month later on a snapchat account i didn't even know she had she would apparently download the app to use and then delete it so i wouldn't see it well one morning i guess she forgot to delete the app and i noticed a snapchat notification on her phone so i opened it up she once again randomly added a ton of people like who she would talk and send pictures to at all hours of the night normally snapchat doesn't save your messages unless you specifically set it to which she and the creeps she was speaking with had the chats and photos i had the absolute horror of discovering were unbelievably explicit the absolute worse you can imagine believe me there was so much it was all she used the app for obviously i freaked out i grounded her from her devices explained how dangerous and inappropriate what she is doing was had a bit a melt down myself afterwards and life went on a few weeks later i see a notification on my own facebook that my niece had joined a group odd as she has no device so i checked into it using her school computer she has an iep allowing her a personal laptop at school to do her work she had joined a facebook group for adults to specifically speak explicitly with one another so another talk more privileges taken for a period of time eventually she gets her phone back with limited access and periodic check ins to see what she's up to she's behaving schools going good no issues on the phone so i get a bit lax allowed her messenger again for can't download apps and has been continuing to contact people by telling them to add her on there and using the chat feature pinterest i didn't even know there was a chat function one final detail that i am reluctant to even put into words all of it from the very beginning was very intense sexting surrounding a dd lg relationship like very specifically always this the facebook group she joined was for one to find the other i don't know if this means anything am i reading into this too much it's like she will do anything to talk to these creeps in this way like go to any length to be able to so i've had this issue with my yr old take away all internet all of it even the school computer trust me they will understand we are going on months without her having any access including a smart tv cause guess what they can use that too they also know how to use spotify as a chat program she's been enrolled in adolescent medicine so she's getting medication currently to help with depression and is on a bunch of therapy wait lists she was catfishing adults on top of having been groomed all of this came from people she met in forrnite since taking that all away she is much happier now even more so that her depression is being addressed she's earned her switch back for single player only she doesn't know the internet password she now has a text and phone call only cell phone that we monitor sporadically but seriously don't be afraid to take that access and definitely get her into therapy since she's obviously suffered some sort of trauma it needs to be addressed

she needs intensive therapy now i would also speak to the school about this even though she may need a device as stated in her iep it’s obvious she is likely spending most of her school time attempting to engage with strangers too so i would be inclined to do a total reset and remove all devices for now of course she will use her friends phones etc but at least you can limit this for a while she sounds like she is working through some intense trauma having someone specialized in this area to work with her is key i think you also have to understand she will continue doing this as long as she has access and as long as she has unresolved trauma don’t be surprised each time it happens be proactive and keep an open dialogue with her so she does not feel shamed

most likely your niece has been abused online by a peadophile with this fetish it’s very common when children have been exposed in one way to sexual contact material that they then seek out that same type of contact conversation this is absolutely not her fault she’s been exposed somehow to this world and it’s very hard to reverse that interest now without some professional intervention if you haven’t already try and establish if any of these people appear to be adults then call the police most likely they are adult sexual predators or at least some amongst them they need reporting because they will likely be doing this with other children police will now even work with police in other countries to catch these people your niece is very much a victim and should not be shamed or punished but you do need to set clear boundaries and expectations of her and remove all devices school need to be aware and on board too i’m not an expert in monitoring devices but believe when the time comes to give her phone etc back that you can ‘clone’ her phone in a sense so you can see in real time what she’s doing ask your school for support around this as they should know a service to refer you to to help with this i’m a manager in children’s safeguarding services and unfortunately this is far far too common i’m really sorry it’s happened to your niece and you

first you’re doing a lot learning a lot handling a lot and experiencing a lot all at once take a second to breathe now understand your niece is going through a lot too we don’t know the circumstances from which she was removed from her home and in your care but this behavior is not typical and she is in need of some serious therapy and quick i would call the pediatrician and the insurance and start calling the pediatrician can help get things moving with a referral and sometimes get a child into a therapist office fast when needed second no phone or internet privileges this is to keep her safe i understand you need to get a hold of her and you have options there are parental safety phones and apps and flip phones if she has an iphone there’s a parental option that she needs permission to download anything i would seriously consider a phone with no internet access as far as her school computer there should be precautions in place to prevent kids from accessing social media—i would tell the school of this incident third she’s and she does not need social media including pinterest look up what social media does and decide for yourself the correlation between mental illnesses in teens and social media is real there are law suits right now about this but do your own research and come to a conclusion fourth clearly she doesn’t understand internet danger i’d contact your case worker and see if they have advice on moving forward and also to document this this also sounds like it warrants a police report these strangers are in possession of her explicit photos minor and have been communicating explicitly with a minor lastly get yourself some help with going through this this is going to a long road of helping your niece take care and good luck one day at a time

year old called police the title says it we live in florida and the school was cancelled because the hurricane ian was coming my wife was at work and i was staying home with our kids f and m i put my daughter down for her nap and my son was playing roblox on his phone i know i know i started getting the place ready for the hurricane by nailing down anything that can fly and getting all of the garbage together to dispose of it now we live in an apartment community and the garbage disposal is a minute walk from our building it's not a rare occasion that you would see cars with garbage bags on their hood driving by because the disposal is next to the entrance exit of the community when i got all of the garbage boxes together i asked my son if he wants to walk with me or to stay home he chose to stay in not the the first time although up to about months ago he was very apprehensive of staying home alone and would always chose the tagging along option so off i went and was gone for about to minutes on a way back i get a phone call from him his phone is fully functional and he has his own number he uses it to video chat with grandparents in ny or call mom at work i work from home and use mobile internet during trips before i could answer the phone call dropped i called him back but the line was busy i knew something was up so i ran home it took me about seconds after his call to get there when i made it he was in tears and on a phone with someone who i was pretty sure was my wife he saw me walking in said to whoever it was that everything is fine now bye and hung up i asked him what happened and he said he thought i was missing he said he needs to tell me something i said sure he said i thought it was an emergency and called sure enough his phone started ringing and it was a local police department calling back to make sure we are fine the lady said she received a phone call from a child stating that his father was missing i assured her that everything is fine indeed and i was only gone for minutes taking a garbage out prior to hurricane hitting the area she said thank you for confirming and that was the end of it but my son was in so much stress he thought the police will come and take him away from us and place him with foster parents his best friend's parents are going through a really bad divorce that's where he gets his info from i did my best to convince him it is not going to happen unless he will continue calling the police every time i'm gone for less than minutes obviously i'm not going to leave him home alone again even if he begs me to we had a long conversation about what real emergencies are and when it's a good call to get the police involved he was shaken for about minutes or so after it happened and then went to his usual self he brought it up again when my wife came home and we went through what the emergency situations are again he truly believed it was an emergency and i was lost or something that is why he made a call i blame roblox he might have lost the track of time playing his rainbow friends game for context we never left our kids home alone not a single time cleaning outside or walking a dog if they don't want to join but can still see us is the only time when they are inside by themselves anyway i would love if you could share similar incidents and how you handled them tldr my kid called the police while i was taking the garbage out and he thought i was gone missing it all happened within minutes span ps i see that some of you have different opinion whether or not my son should have a fully functional phone i want to make it clear that i see no harm in him using his phone and play some games on it he gets about an hour of game time per day he may still use his phone for other tasks like reading math drawing etc all of it is easily controlled through parents app and phone settings when i said i was blaming roblox for what happened i was making a joke i'm not taking his phone away from him downvotes will not make me do it as well

i have a vivid memory from my childhood… my parents my younger sister and me were moving my grandmother into a condo closer to our home back then we had a little portable tv with a dvd player my parents plugged it into the wall and put a movie on for us while they moved stuff in well i had never moved before i was probably around the same age as your son actually and didn’t realize how long this took especially with them needing to catch an elevator for every trip in my child mind i thought “oh my god my parents have gone missing” and my sister and i looked out the window to find them — nowhere to be seen freaked out we paused our movie and hopped in the elevator to go down to the lobby to search for our parents my parents didn’t see us in the condo and we all essentially went up and down the elevators missing each other each time and i genuinely thought my parents either disappeared or left us for good boy were they mad when they finally found us this was slightly before cell phones at least i didn’t have one yet so there was no way to text call ping and the lobby people thought we were playing around so they said nothing

first of all child knowing how to call and having access to a phone is an awesome thing and does save people's lives your child did his best for you with the information he thought he had before cellphones kids of all ages had access to phones in every home and also called him having a phone is not the issue second my own freaking phone called when i was on a walk my lock screen was on my phone was on silent because it almost always is my phone called from the emergency screen and all they heard was rustling and heavy breathing they called and called me back several times we live in the country and i don't know how fast gps works but they were starting the process to try to find where the call came from when i took out my phone to look at the time i realized my phone was ringing and i answered the operator was so happy it was a butt dial and not someone being attacked mistakes happen i felt awful time is a very hard concept especially during a frightening experience real or perceived i am sure this was a learning experience for all of you please don't shame your son for trying to help you he did his best just work on new strategies to keep track of time and make several attempts to contact mom and dad first

it sounds like an anxiety flare bless him he suddenly worried a lot you were gone my year old can be similar during pandemic i was at home basically for two years and we were never apart the first time i had to leave minor dental surgery he was massively anxious about how long i’d be gone as he’d gotten used to me being there took a while for the anxiety about me not being around to lessen as life started going back to normal i have a hypnotherapy audio kids anxiety pack that you are welcome to try for free i have an year old and i play them at night sometimes includes anxiety elimination confidence and positivity etc they aren’t much different from the adult ones i listen to essentially tells you to close eyes relax think of a happy safe space if you could help him think of one before hand might help and then affirmations about letting go of anxiety

have you noticed any tendency towards anxiety in general absolutely no judgement if so some kids just come wired that way mine did the reason i ask is that some intuitive kind things that any parent might do to soothe and reassure such a child can actually accidentally make things worse this book is worth reading on the topic *anxiety relief for kids on the spot strategies to help your child overcome worry panic and avoidance* by bridget flynn walker phd of course i don't know your kid so this may not apply at all but with my anxiety prone kid i seriously wish i'd learned earlier how to help effectively

there's a lot of good comments here that highlight the importance of boundaries and educating your daughter a yr old is old enough to start learning financial responsibility i personally would recommend a prepaid debt card that she can use for these subscriptions using her own money that she's been able to save up or that she works for these can be reloaded when they run out which also gives you the ability to limit her on how much she can spend if there's no money on the card her subscriptions will automatically cancel and you xan take the opportunity to teach her how to cancel the subscription she pays for if a prepaid card feels like too much you can also manage subscriptions with gift cards that can only be used on specific apps she needs to be able to see how her money is being spent teaching her how to use a budget can also help her but this will only work if you follow through with establishing boundaries with grandma i'd also give her an electronics time out she abused phone privileges so she looses the phone for a set amount of time when you give it back make sure she understands why she lost the phone and what the consequence was and that it will be taken away for longer if it happens again if she values having a phone she will respect the boundaries i might recommend that if a phone is important for communication then if the problem persists after taking it away more than once then you xan downgrade her to a flip phone that only has minutes these were things my parents did in similar situations when i was her age and it made a huge difference you got this mama

honestly your best resource to get info about particular games might be just to ask here on reddit enough of us are gamers that you're likely to get decent advice anything online with the ability to chat with other players runs some risk of exposing them to pretty awful people and pretty awful content this isn't to say you should disallow online games but you should establish ground rules for what's acceptable and what's not talking to people trying to get pictures or personal information is not ok anyone yelling racial slurs or screaming about ethnic groups political groups sexual identities and so forth should just be ignored i routinely report and ignore wannabe nazis and the like on the wwii themed first person shooter i like to play anyone advertising in game stuff for sale with your credit card or paypal account should probably be avoided once you get past that well some of my longest running friendships have started as people i first encountered in online games and chatrooms if you use caution and some common sense it's as rewarding as any other social setting

let me start off by saying roblox is full of kids but not only you need to talk to your daughter about a few things first off never give anyone too much information and **never** let anyone else know your password make sure you write passwords down accounts can have a lot of in game ”items” that your daughter probably worked hard for also warn her about scamming a lot of people trick others online to steal their items items can have value in real life don’t know if that’s the case in roblox i had an item stolen from me that i had worked hard for but in another game make sure to not take words personal and serious this happened to me but on social media i was about and someone called me a dickhead i cried and told my mom i learned from there that it’s normal and this tip is for you i am into gaming and got into it young here are a few tips take breaks this is very important and is very good to create a habit out of tell your daughter to get up while she’s playing and do some physical movements could be stretching or anything really while taking the breaks make sure to drink water staying hydrated as you know is very important and can be forgotten as time can be lost track of when playing don’t let your daughter have social medias maybe when she becomes old enough to actually have an account on most social medias i wouldn’t recommend getting social medias at all as they just affect you in negative ways and are addicting i can’t think of more right now my phone is almost dead i will go to sleep and respond to any of your questions tomorrow i might just be but i would call myself mature enough and experienced enough to know what i am talking about

there’s lots of good advice in this post and i’d like to add a couple to keep an eye for basic internet safety make sure she knows to keep her personal information to herself where she lives what school etc i personally tell my son not to share his age just that he is a kid with his online friends as well as passwords and be weary about sharing info that can potentially be used for password recovery favorite food color pets names favorite teacher etc as for your daughter keep her engaged in talking to you about what she does online ask her about what kinds of games she plays in roblox many are user created ask her about her friends she plays with ask her about her drawings you want to keep the dialog about her online life open so that she’s comfortable to talk to you should anything bad happen you’ll also want to keep an eye on her behavior being ‘obsessed’ with something her age isn’t uncommon boy bands were my vice around that age but if she suddenly becomes obsessed real life being sacrificed for online life or drops it suddenly while being moody and avoiding talking about it it might be a good idea to gently pry the best thing and the worst thing about the internet is that everyone uses it at the end of the day you don’t know who you’re talking to through the screen at the end of the day moderation caution and open dialog are always good there’s no need to restrict so long as everyone is comfortable and real life isn’t suffering there’s also no need to be paranoid but a little caution helps with peace of mind if nothing else and talking to your kids about the stuff they love does wonders for them even if it can be a bit tedious for us you and your daughter seem to be doing great keep it up

i went through a similar situation with my year old boy and was absolutely floored by his behavior towards another kid in a group online bullying situation while he had other consequences apologizing had him read a kid friendly article on what bullying does to others… it’s tough to take away their phone completely one because we need to be able to get ahold of him because we’re both working parents and he’s active in sports and academics and two of how his school uses qr codes to provide access to almost everything each classes syllabus links to parent forms registration for clubs sports registration etc which is a whole other issue in itself anyway i blocked or deleted everything on his phone for two months like internet access can’t download any apps airdrop the whole nine yards basically i turned his phone into a “dumb phone” because he only had access to his camera for qr codes texting and calling i limited his contacts during certain hours through screen time on his apple phone and he couldn’t add contacts unless i approved them anyway looking back i’m glad i took it so seriously because then he had to take it his behavior seriously as well if that makes sense hope this helps

friends technology sleepovers so we have a year old girl who is very smart and funny and is a really great mix of youthfulness and worldliness she has some really great friends who we like some were wary of just like anyone else she has an iphone and an ipad mostly we got her the ipad during the pandemic so she could talk to her cousin hours away and the phone because we need to be able to reach her obviously we have both devices locked down tight with apple’s parental controls so she doesn’t have a lot of access to them and definitely no access to the internet social media i feel like we’re in the minority and it’s so frustrating about a year ago she went though a very depressive episode and had been spending a lot more time on her devices which led me to with her knowing look into her roblox account and messaging history one specific friend seemed to be going through some very difficult stuff and while we feel very empathetic for this child it was all stuff we didn’t want our child to even be exposed to and that i had no idea about until i was very much a teen she no longer has access to roblox and through talking to her about all of this learned that at a slumber party they went into omegle on her friends phone something i didn’t even know was a thing and saw “ dicks and a tit ” she was traumatized we explained to her how those people could be put in jail for exposing themselves to a minor and seemed to understand she went through a bout of therapy and is seeming to do a lot better recently and i think she’s mostly dropped the friend she was with on the omegle incident the one with the struggle we’ve said she can be friends with at school but they have no contact outside of school my question mainly is yes it’s great that we can keep her devices locked down but how do we know they’re safe at friends’ houses obviously we can’t control everything and they’re going to be exposed to things we don’t want them to be but how do you handle it when her friends come here they know to give me their phones but all her friends just have completely unregulated access to anything they want how do you guys deal i just hate how fast this generation is growing up with the internet i feel our kid is the only one who enjoys playing and doing kid stuff still and it breaks my heart for all of them i’m just frustrated at the other parents for not protecting their kids thanks

okay so all i can give is advice based on what i've learned so far my daughter was also exposed to similar content at a cousins house and it seriously caused some issues i learned i can't stop what she's going to be exposed to when i'm not around i have to trust her to make the right choice and stop it or redirect or if need be get an adult also you can disable all chat from roblox this way she can at least play the games my social media policy with her is that i have access to all her accounts until she is to make sure she is safe not to snoop or read private conversation she is now and is old enough to meet age restrictions on several apps now she's chosen not to get them i think in part because i dont she's more family oriented right now than peer so i'm lucky in that sense she does have chatting apps i monitor but be nosey but not secretive ask her what she's doing and how the game works who her friend are and what's going on with them tell them about your friends age appropriately of course how you feel about things create an open dialog make sure she knows she can come to you always even if she pushes you'll still be standing there i think chat shouldn't be restricted but she should feel like if a friends conversation raises red flags go to mom mom can help she knows i am monitoring her accounts for her safety at this point i'd like to think she doesn't mind because she'll even ask me what i thought about something someone said in a chat or ask me to go look to get my opinion

i need help with how to approach my daughter f i f let my daughter f play roblox because i thought it was safe don’t come at me i literally saw it and thought “kids game” well i installed bark on her phone which is essentially a parental app to keep tabs on your kids to make sure she’s being safe today i saw some things on the app that seemed a little weird so i checked the laptop and she was still signed in so i took a peek she has been pretending to be a boy talking to another boy about having sex with him she doesn’t know i know but i really want to have a talk about it with her and don’t know how to approach it so here i am…asking reddit does anyone have any advice on how to go about talking with her about this and the dangers of chatting online and also lying to people about who she is i’m just lost and do not know how to approach the conversation without the classic pre teen shutting down because of awkward conversation how do i tell her i found the conversation how do i keep her safe 😞

there are a couple different really important issues here number one is the chatting with strangers your daughter now knows exactly how easy it is to pretend to be someone she’s not but i doubt she has considered how easily she could be fooled by someone pretending to be a child as well in fact that could be what’s happening right now so out of a ton of concern i would approach this situation very carefully but firmly as soon as possible i have personally let my kids know this is the biggest concern and they are never to give out their names town school name etc and that if anyone is ever threatening them even with real information they weren’t supposed to give out that they can come to us no matter what we’ve explicitly explained the types of threats predators and scammers might use so that hopefully they can recognize that and still come to us i’ve described in detail how they can threaten to hurt your family how they can offer to take you away for awhile of your parents are hounding you etc all the things in my opinion knowledge is power here and i often do it in the car where they have to listen and can’t go away does she know about bark and we’re there any rules put in place where she knew you could look at her devices at any time i would be honest and concerned but try to avoid showing anger i think i would avoid any punishments at this time although moving screen time to a common room might be a suggestion

you can tell her you learned the game has a chat feature which isn’t safe for kids explain why without ever letting her know you saw her chats i think reading her chat makes sense—you needed to see if she had sent anything that could put her in danger however she will see it as a violation of privacy just let her know you saw online that it has features that aren’t safe for her if there’s a way to disable that feature and let her still play great you could use gender inclusive language in the future to help her feel safe opening up to you example “is there anyone you want to go to the dance with ” instead of “are there any boys you want to go to the dance with ”

let’s take this from the perspective of the daughter yo curious likely recognizes that this is not an approved line of conversation if i was and told not to do something online i would more than likely get better at hiding it which is exactly what i did when i was in my opinion it needs to be a non judgmental conversation entirely only informative and protective how you tell her you know about the conversation is entirely up to you however the conversation needs to be had in a very real tone vs hypothetical if it’s hypothetical she may not even relate it to what you’re trying to talk about if this is the type of conversation my parents had with me at i feel i would have been far more receptive and likely would have found myself in a lot less trouble than i did *while in the car like another commenter suggested so she can’t walk away when she gets uncomfortable* “hey my daughter i was doing some reading on some of the dangers of the internet and i wanted to chat with you about it” … *the pause is important* … “one thing that kept reoccurring in the dangers for young ladies your age is online sex talk it’s not that the talk is bad or wrong it’s that the other person is anonymous i heard that old men *like * be dramatic keep it light hearted will pretend to be the same age as the girls playing the game and convince them to start an online relationship that’s not so bad for the young ladies but then when they both trust each other these old men will start asking for pictures one story i read about was the old man talked with the young girls for over a year to build her trust and get these photos… did you know that’s illegal for him to have these photos… makes me want to throw up just thinking about it… ” still very jokingly not blaming not saying this is the wrong thing for her to do just emphasize how it’s not safe and you have no idea where things will end up another thing with these online predators that’s you may or may not want to educate your daughter on is that the predators may use these photos to blackmail her into more photos different “acts” and even meeting in person once they have these photos they will use them in anyway that gets her to do what they want in this day and age it’s extremely likely she’s going to send nudes to someone at some point in time the absolute best you can do is assure her that you’re a safe person to talk to if those photos end up in the wrong hands it could even be her first boyfriend’s friend group and if that happens she should know she can talk to her to help her through it
if you’re looking for a sample script or practice conversations or to listen to someone else do it first check out emily she’s great she practices age appropriate sex positivity
bbc newsround's caught in the web is a good starting point for this sort of conversation
surrounding safety it might be a good idea to point out how easy it is to lie about who you are online if she’s lying about who she is… how easy it it for others to do

with our son when he began to venture online we let him know we would spot check his messages occasionally we did we never reacted strongly to anything we found there we just gently let him know what we thought of the occasional extreme thing we also had to coach him as to how to extract himself from a series of exchanges with a girl who we knew was lying about her age he appreciated our help but then we never really found anything like what you've found i think that no matter how nonreactive you are she would be super humiliated if you were to bring it up however going forward whatever else you do let her know that you can access her messages and will do so a occasionally so long as she is very young and b in an emergency or in case of extreme concern even when she is older

i have been in this same situation before and the stance i took on it was that yes many of us did very similar things when we were younger but the internet is a much different and much more dangerous place now that it ever was back then my thoughts and i explained this to my child are that if they are grown enough to be talking and acting this way they are definitely grown enough to talk to me about it and learn the very real life risks and dangers of what they are doing we then had a conversation about how amazing the internet has potential to be but it’s my job to keep them safe from an ever growing atrocities that can come from being online and explained they are not old enough or have the mental or emotional capacity or be informed enough at their age to choose the safest things for themselves yet i did go into detail about the things that can happen and have real life examples because as i said if they think they are grown enough to be doing these things they’re grown enough to hear what has happened in the past i know it sounds very harsh but it is the only thing that has truly worked

it sounds like she's in control here and i'm not saying that to be mean judgemental or anything i'm definitely a pushover parent myself you say that she throws a fit until you give her more time you started at hour only but are now at she's going to continue to push the limit because she knows you'll give in before taking it away which i honestly don't really agree with maybe try strictly enforcing the rules sit down and explain the rules you get hour no more you can have a minute warning minute warning and minute warning and then i will be taking the game for the night end of story let her throw her tantrum have fun wearing yourself out i've learned that for my son yo with audhd things are best when it's in day increments or at most days so everything starts over again in the morning otherwise it becomes a sort of why even try i'm never going to do better ever i also try not to give more punishments for meltdowns that don't include violence for example i take the switch away and he stomps his foot whines and cries runs to his room and pouts for an hour oh well you just wasted an hour i don't negotiate or give him attention he can try again tomorrow i will say as someone who loves minecraft myself even i struggle with putting the controller down sometimes i just need to finish this building i just need more nights and i can get the diamonds i need but only more trees need to be chopped down maybe some suggestions to help would be playing with her sometimes and letting her see you struggling to put the game down oh man i really want to keep playing but i know that if i don't start dinner now it won't be ready in time and my stomach is growling i'm sad i can't play but i'm looking forward to food hey what if we cooked together and upping the positive rewards attention when she's put it away

i have a child who has had issues with this and we use parental controls to remove the power struggle over it and it has helped many devices such as switches and tablets have timers that lock the device after a certain amount of time they give time up reminders too so the child isn't totally surprised by it i would avoid any devices that do not have parental controls then utilize the parental controls on the ones that do sit them down and let them know ahead of time that the device is timed for hour each day and then it won't work any more then follow through on using it and don't add more time for that day when they do have a tantrum you can focus on empathy instead of having to bargain with them to do something that may truly be too difficult for them

it takes time for them to learn to control it my daughter used to be this way now i tell her the time that she needs to be off by and she will close the tablet and put it away herself she knows if she chooses to have a meltdown or not comply she loses the privilege she's and we have been practicing for years now took her a while when she gets the tablet there is always a moment of connection where i remind her you have x amount of time if you choose to get upset you won't have any time tomorrow

set a schedule and stick to it she’ll get used to it when i enabled screen time with limitations there were freak outs at first but they got used to it screens go off at pm we shower read and get ready for bed and year old

yep my son hit the jackpot on gaming parents we are proud of it my son is now in a few weeks i honestly think it’s a great advantage the reason is because as gamers we completely understand what is out there in the online gaming community my son is completely aware of online safety and often times if there is a little one in the group he will take them under his wing and include them he also really wants a new gaming pc i am proud of him because he is saving money for one we have all the systems including the oculus he has loads of friends at school and all of them game too recently he started using discord this also gives us an advantage as discord users ourselves we have a saying in our house “a family that games together stays together ” whether that’s board games or video games 😉 the biggest advantage is that my son is wanting to learn coding and how to build apps in middle school he is doing computer classes for all his electives i told him if he really wants to learn this start now and don’t wait till college because it will be a easier the nice thing now is as a parent you can set up screen limits with microsoft to regulate screen time i did this when he was younger now that he older he respects the times and i don’t need to

i game with my year old all the time i also make sure that i am setting healthy boundaries by only playing for an hour or so after chores homework and also making sure we take breaks to play outside and socialize with others nothing wrong with the games just model health behavior with them

i game and watch tv and crochet and play with my kid and bake cakes and do laundry and cook dinner i play or watch tv while she's awake it teaches her to learn to play by herself when i first started being a stay at home mom i felt the same way as you i thought i was only allowed to clean and cook and i started getting so stressed out because that meant i never had time to do anything that i wanted to do my husband has had to instill into my brain that the house doesn't have to be spotless every day and i don't have to cook every day to be a good mother he and i were raised very differently so i'm glad that he believes that and it's taken some work to get to where we are but he also helps me around the house when he gets off work like with cooking or cleaning out feeding the toddler or bathing her there is no perfect mom only the perfect mom for your kids you can teach them your values that you want them to learn while still gaming some days i still neoprene i'm supposed to just clean and cook and be miserable but other days i don't have such a guilty conscience

wtf gaming is a hobby and nothing to be ashamed about i am gamer dad and i don't hide it i just make sure that they can handle things in moderation; no matter if it's gaming youtube baking or sleeping

hey my kids have grown up around video games my babies fell asleep being held while we played games all of our kids are excellent students and they grew up playing video games too they started on abc mouse as soon as they took an actual interest in games like months old all started prek being able to read and write which their teachers were super surprised about their whole lives we have made sure to show that while gaming is great real life always comes first we make family priority and no one is allowed to play games or watch tv without knocking out chores homework and hour of “reading time” first daddy goes to work when he comes home he spends time with the kids helps with homework helps with dinner and whatever needs doing before he plays games and that helps i think by setting the biggest example for them i’m a sahm so i tend to use my kid free time while they are at school to play games so when they come home they see me shutting my games off and spending time with them i usually do chores after they get on the bus til about lunchtime and then game a few hours before they get home cooking dinner and doing whatever else needs doing honestly there’s nothing wrong with being a gaming family so long as you make a point to teach the kiddos priorities like homework education household chores and going to work is important

my kids are and … i played no less than hours a day of video games during their childhood one is a music scholar one manages a restaurant the other a normal drama filled senior in high school none of them video game addicts they really are their own little people… as long as you don’t do something like shove it down their throat because you think it’s cute or whatever they’ll be fine mama don’t ever change don’t lose yourself also good job… the fact that you care says so much

not a gamer mom but i have a “non traditional” career for a female engineer and “non traditional” mom hobbies so far my kid is only four but he doesn’t seem to have any problems engineering has actually been super helpful connecting with him on things he’s interested in like yeah i have some traditional mom hobbies like crafting and baking but i’ve used them to teach engineering principles my son has learned how to “draft” design ideas for crafts before getting started on building things for example i’m sure the same can be done for gaming i think it’s important for kids to see their parents are still people and have hobbies and activities outside of being a parent it makes for happier more fulfilled parents too my parents gave up all their hobbies when they had kids stopped doing date nights etc and it really warped my perception of a relationships and b what parenting is actually like it also lead to a ton of resentment and pent up anger from my parents directed at the kids my mom finally took up gardening when i was in high school and it was a huge difference in her general attitude towards being a parent

gamer dad here but the rules are the same regardless of age gender or who's the parent games are for when chores and work are done you do not get to game until your responsibility are taken care of you need to enforce this rule for yourself your so and your child ren

moms do all kinds of things i loathe cooking and make sculpture and do carpentry we also have a gamer household spouse works in the game industry i wanted to address your concerns about game addiction which i think are valid especially for kids gaming doesn't seem to be harmful in itself but it does eat up time that would otherwise be spent doing activities that have very strong positives for development reading playing outside studying building being bored one theory seeking to explain why girls now outperform boys at almost every academic level all the way up to graduate school is that boys spend considerably more time gaming than girls; girls are still reading books folks like my spouse spend hours every day pouring over data to make their game more fun and compelling to players spouse and his team members are good at their jobs so even if they don't set out to make an addictive product what will be the result of a few years of this effort the game is really really really compelling an immature brain has frankly no chance of resisting its allure i did not want to be constantly fighting about time limits so our rule therefore was no screen amusement for kiddo during the week weekends only it worked really well we relaxed it for covid so kid could hang out with friends online but by then kiddo was in high school

woke up at am because something is bothering me couldn’t sleep so i thought i’d find help and found this reddit community thank you for reading this and taking the time to respond about one month ago i found out that my daughter years of age was struggling with depression and we have since found her mental help by connecting her with a therapist just last night my son years of age started crying and said he felt he was going to die when he started crying my heart just fell to my stomach and i felt as though i had failed now twice as a parent my true understanding of what i believe my son was trying to say was he was sad bored and struggling with life my sons routine is usually go to school remotely on zoom until about pm; take a break; finish homework at around pm; play roblox and watch youtube until dinner time ; play roblox and watch youtube and go to sleep normally when he is playing roblox he is on facetime with his closest cousin and they play talk a lot however he has not been as available recently throughout the week and only more so on weekends i of course will jump in and play roblox or watch a show with my son at least once every other day for about hours also i make it a point everyday during dinner to talk as a family and ask everyone how their day was my wife too will jump in and play roblox with him for about two hours that is the normal routine perhaps this has been my down fall and not giving my kids enough of my time during the pandemic our routine has changed dramatically my wife and i in efforts to keep us safe have remained in doors we may have taken it to the extreme and only really gone out for food until recently the kids almost always stay at home while i go get the food perhaps this has been my biggest mistake by isolating the kids too much i’ve since tried changing our ways and starting getting out for walks or taking the kids to drive around the neighborhood for example today we walked to target and purchased some treats and new version of uno we played that after dinner for about an hour this does not seem to have fixed anything but i’m going to continue trying to go outside this post is getting long so i’ll get to the questions am i a total idiot by letting my son watch youtube and play roblox all day without restrictions do i just need to man up and spend the entire afternoon with my kids do you think this is large in part to the isolation of the pandemic or perhaps the scare of being unsafe because of the pandemic any advice is welcome and i appreciate your honestly thank you i’m just so very hurt by this and want to be a better father

i feel like your taking this to personally this hole situation has been hard for everyone i do think that it is important to get the kids out of the house as much as possible they need some nature and probably some vitamin d from the sun maybe try going on walks in the neighborhood it can't be healthy to be cooped up in the house all the time you can still get out of the house and be safe our kids start going crazy when they have been in the house too long we do not take them to the store and i know they miss that

you guys sound like amazing parents parenting during this pandemic is new waters for all of us i was trying to do the responsible thing and basically shut us off from the world and covid but i noticed my toddler became more restless so try taking them out more on the weekends when you know certain places will be more empty for example i take my daughter out to the park around am donut shops around am certain stores when i know they’ll be empty your kids are also older so they’re able to wear a mask so that’s great opens up a bunch of things to do we also do a lot of hiking arts and crafts i think this absolutely has to do with being isolated during a pandemic and not being in school it’s easy for us adults to adjust because we understand that there is a pandemic but we really just uprooted our kids lives school stopped socializing stopped basically the normal stopped i don’t think you have to spend the whole afternoon with them maybe just take a few hours to change it up for them so things aren’t so mundane

you need to drastically cut that screentime and make sure your son gets outside time and independent play time with actual toys every day he needs to develop skills to deal with boredom and frustration and big feelings and screen time is a crutch that you are letting him overuse it’s helping him set aside ignore feelings instead of being inside his own head and dealing with them and then at the end of the day the feelings are still there and he hasn’t had a chance to process them i get it parenting in a pandemic is parenting on hard mode for sure but you’ve gotta detox that screen addiction and teach your son some healthier coping strategies or you are setting him up for long term misery eta sorry this sounds so harsh it’s not intended that way i think you’re on the right track—you’ve recognized the problem and you’re taking steps to fix it that is good parenting

your son needs to be doing way more then that with his life and needs non screen time there is no reason you cant safely do things outdoors and he definitely needs exercise the family is also his only source of in person interactions you need to be doing more then a couple of hours every other day

this resonates so much i'm black and have a dark skin tone around was when i also started to have these thoughts my mom's approach was a slow drip of positive black influences for example she would give me beautiful black barbie dolls to play with take me to plays musicals shows featuring black artists e g alvin ailey give me books that spoke about confidence in how you look expose me to potential role models that looked like me expose me to musicians that looked like me back then this looked like buying their cassette cds leaving magazines around the house especially bathrooms that were specific to black culture essence ebony etc we occasionally had more serious talks but really seeing all these beautiful examples of dark skinned people over the course of my formative years helped me see that i could be beautiful too i emphasize that it was a slow drip we didn't have black is beautiful proverbial signs all over the house it was just a steady showcase of black positivity
