i think it’s time to have a frank and honest discussion about internet safety and how to develop her own healthy boundaries when i was her age i made a myspace profile and my mom found it i had some age inappropriate stuff on there but my mom didn’t freak out she and i sat down at the computer together while i navigated through the site and explained to me why certain pictures were not smart to put online on a public profile asked how i felt about some language friends were using in chats etc her approach worked—i felt like i could trust her and followed her guidance because she laid it out in a way that made sense for my whole adolescence i felt ok going to her if i saw something online that made me feel uncomfortable

discord is just a social platform it's like a chat server banning discord though fine if that's what you want to do won't really solve your problem she is determined to chat online with people's she knows and people she probably doesn't know she will find another forum to chat on

not a parent but i was a kid who grew up with mostly unrestricted internet access i also use discord pretty much daily this is a tough one because the more you push the better she will get at hiding it from you i would know i got really good at hiding that kind of stuff from my mom however you should know that it's against discord's terms of service to be below the age of on their platform so she likely had to lie about her age to even make an account i think you first and foremost should find out exactly who she's talking to especially those that you don't recognize does she know them from school or online does she know how old they are are they sending her inappropriate messages that aren't just jokes or memes also does she have a cellphone if discord's on her laptop it's likely on her phone too as far as punishment trying to scare her out of doing it likely won't work there should be consequences for lying but also i understand the appeal of having a discord server for a group of friends with a shared interest that in itself should be fine as long as it's kept appropriate and from your description it looks like it hasn't been again not a parent but honestly if she's just engaging in the one server and you are worried about the content of it i'd ask to join the server so you can see the conversations and content being posted in real time if it's not kept appropriate or she makes another server to avoid you being in it then i'd go ahead and take it away completely is not old enough for unsupervised internet usage take it from someone who was that age and talking to the wrong crowd online and has many regrets regarding that edit also if you have any questions about discord i'd be happy to answer

if your teen daughter shares dirty jokes swears and looks at risqué pictures in a chat with her friends she is probably doing the same things in person if that is all i was doing online at that age my mother would have been proud this all sounds like normal behavior of someone becoming a young adult have a convo with her about online stranger danger and what she should share with people she does not know but aside from that as long as she is not getting into trouble let her be herself with her friends maybe ask that she limit her conversations to people she knows irl

education beats authoritarian punishment i’m not a big fan of denying kids social outlets it typically has negative consequences seek first to understand then to be understood everything you’ve described is normal behavior for kids on social media

i would let her stay on discord because it is an important way to stay in touch with friends however all screens should always be in public areas of the house also you should know her passwords and spot check messages do not overreact to what you find there stay calm

i’m going through the exact same situation with my year old daughter i’m trying my best to remain calm i don’t want to take away social interaction but the things i saw in that chat were disgusting and i am open minded and have a dirty sense of humor racism misogyny unhealthy sex talk idk what to do we talked about online safety we talked about how the internet trail will follow her for the rest of her life

discord is the sole method of communication i use with my son when he’s not with me we have our own server where we keep notes and important documents like schedules and such we share memes and call on discord when he’s at his dads it’s a great tool give discord a chance there’s some wild stuff on there but i think it’s best to try and be open and honest ask her why she’s in those servers help her find servers more age appropriate show her you’re open minded and she won’t feel like she has to keep secrets from you also it’s how he kept in touch with friends during the pandemic and as him and friends move on to different schools taking discord away from him is cutting off his social circle

i let my kids use discord at for middle school chats it was the only social media permitted with that said we made an agreement my kids could only friend people they knew in person that were students at their school after school activities or camp they stuck to that i would periodically check and it was okay so maybe talk about stranger danger and needing to know who you talk to because others could be adults posting as kids sometimes i will read aitah posts and stuff here to show my kids stuff that they could encounter this way they hear my pov without it being accusatory to them it is just a discussion about other people and what would each of us do in that situation
so important thing to note discord is by its own rules for people ages of + only it is against the site's terms of service to use discord when under

you can make it so your childs account has administrator permissions off so they cant install discord you can also maybe use a content blocker to block the discord com domain there are loopholes though like vpns and extension disabling

okay yes i'm doing good at not freaking out on her i told her i need to think abt a few things before we talk abt it i remember whn my mom would yell at me as a kid i never processed what she said i just knew she was yelling made me put my defense up now shes in her room reading an actual book immediately an activity i support wholeheartedly her grandpa gifted her the laptop so she could use it for writing stories which she's really really good at and it makes me so happy to see her do that otherwise she wouldn't have had one for a good while the same with a cell phone it's everybody against me in favor of her having one i just think back to all the things unsuperised internet use and my first cellphone exposed me to and idk i guess i just worry i want to protect her from things i wasn't protected from i genuinely want to take the computer away never wanted her to have it yet another thing that gets me is she's an only child and she says these friends are who she can talk to and joke with etc imagining not having grown up with other kids around like i did makes me sad it makes total sense she wants to chat with other kids who share her interests so i feel guilty taking it away
hearing that helped me relax abt it some i could've googled it but according to her and her generation ima senior citizen now

i don't mind her making new friends i actually know the main ones she always speaks to daily i guess it felt a bit safer and more familiar over on roblox especially with the safety features it would've gone differently had she just showed me and asked it's sounding like roblox was elementary and now she's gone on to discord middle even though she was literally just born 🥺

i hid the same thts why her getting good at hiding things is one of the biggest things i want to avoid like right now for instance we haven't discussed it yet partially bc i want to find the right formula to remain a trusted parent and the last consequence didnt rlly work once i do give her computer privileges back i'll have to figure out how to supervise discord like i did roblox some of the time these friends are strictly online they share so many interests and colorful personalities frm what i've seen it's hard to doubt they aren't kids but also hard not to still worry they're secretly predators according to her they are all around her age range and whn we speak of them we call them by their usernames mostly mildly inappropriate i worry if i let it go on it'll escalate no cell phone yet and i won't budge on this one

that's a big part of the reason i don't want her on there bc what i did when i was on there 🙈 also she's not yet i'm hanging onto that as long as i can lol the first convo at the beginning of summer she did express that she can be herself around her friends and would like to be more involved in conversations in our home now that she's getting older i think it's her way of telling me she knows more than i might realizee she does and i need to start embracing tht

this is very dangerous advice op clearly said that they didn't recognize some of the so called kids on the discord it's one thing to start making jokes with your friends in person when you can make sure that tammy from down the street is really tammy from down the street johnny from the internet could be johnny the year old pedophile i'm not sure if you've been on discord before but yeah there's a lot of weirdos lurking around there i've been legitimately cursed out when people found out i was an actual grown woman high pitched voice

well your not alone for whatever it's worth it wasnt a nice feeling to see how much she knows that i didnt realize she did this age is a whole new level i feel unprepared for i guess trying to teach them how to be safe is one of the most important things we can do online and in life in general bc we cant be in constant ctrl and at some point we lose our say so it's up to them frm there it's scary
discord can be extremely dangerous it's not different that chat rooms we grew up on there are so many predators it's free reign

be careful it may be somewhat common but it’s the most dangerous platform no moderation or filters if any kind so dangerous adults can go there trying to get access to kids and also stupid older teens etc do you know these kids in person talk to her about the high likelihood of anyone she does not know in person being an adult predator mildly mention things you slightly disapprove of bad language real ore teen conversation but let her know clearly when things become dangerous anyone asking her to remove her clothes send sexy pics at age very dangerous asking her to go somewhere to meet them telling her not to tell her parents about them threatening blackmail sadly these are all realistic threats i would insist on computer only in public areas if she has a laptop remove internet access entirely public computer in public area only consider talking to the parents of her friends and all of you agreeing to ban discord and limit all the kids to somewhat more moderated forums tell your daughter you’ll be monitoring her online content until she turns or whatever age seriously it is too dangerous for a year old girl to have unlimited and unmonitored access to discord

my so who was is essential and i tag out when we're both home non work days but during the week i'm not back at work yet he'll get home shower change and then take the child off my hands that gives me time to eat in peace play a video game bathe in peace etc i still do bedtime but it's at least hours a day during the work week that allows me to breathe and since we started doing that i haven't needed breaks as often it was worse in the beginning the tag outs are exactly what it sounds like one of us will tell the other that we're tagging out for x number of minutes or hours and that lets the other person know they're on the hook for the child it's really helped both of us honestly

i am literally in the same boat and year old my husband and i are wfh in jobs that been made busier by the pandemic we're all losing our shit we work all day eat dinner and hang out with the kids for a bit do the bedtime routine and then go back to work to try to finish the stuff we couldn't get done because of the distractions during the day so it feels like it never stops i've got the adhd and i have been coping well for years but i desperately need the structure of the office i cannot function like this and i've started taking medication that i had left over from when it runs out i'm fucked because getting a script for it again is going to be a nightmare my poor kids are being raised by frozen and sesame street we are literally just throwing screens at them to get through the day this has to be terrible for their development i loved having them in daycare they were learning so much and i was always excited to see them for a while they were right next to my office and my daughter and i would get lunch all the time my husband and i are coping sort of by giving each other tiny breaks we take turns watching the kids for a bit while the other one goes and sits somewhere quietly for a few minutes if you're the one who gets up with the kids on the weekend it's understood that you get a nap or a couple of hours of alone time later in the day my husband usually gets up with them on saturday and i do sunday we also split the kids between us a lot which makes them more manageable it's also how we do the things we want to do my husband will take my older child and get her to hang out while he plays guitar i'll take the little one out to the tiny backyard while i garden edit my husband and i also have laundry parties where we hang out and talk and fold laundry while we watch something on tv together this counts as a date now

hubby and i do ‘sick days’ where we take turns usually once every weeks and each pick our day which means if it’s my day i do it all like a single parent from cooking cleaning kids etc it’s a guilt free way for him to be to be selfish sleep in take time for himself hunker in a bedroom basement alone to watch a movie or whatever knowing that he’s going to be wearing the other hat soon and it will be his turn to do it all when it’s my turn i usually have to literally lock myself in the bedroom because the kids naturally flock to me to meet their needs lol it also helps us be empathetic to each other and laugh at how f’n hard it is to keep a house running and children alive lol

internet phone gaming safety how do you take to your kids about internet safety and do you use monitoring software like bark a scary thing happened i looked at my daughter's text she's this is not something i would normally do but there was a concern i found phone texts from a roblox user i have no idea how he got her number or if it's in the profile clearly i need to really discuss safety with by child nevertheless this person was chatting her up trying to get pics and sending pics photos sent were of a teenish boy i don't believe they were real she finally sent a photo herself but called it a picture of her sister who is she's an only child this person immediately sent a google meet chat to her i don't believe she went on and contact stopped after that texts dates last thursday i guess i am a completely naive parent and need to talk to her about safety has a similar situation happened with anyone and how did you handle btw i did contact roblox and the sent me very cya responses and pointed me to there info on safety i asked them if they plan to look into it and how to prevent predatory behavior no response yet

firstly if your child is already you're already behind the game i started talking to my kids about this at she is now she is fully aware that not everybody online is who they say they are we have covered all of the red flag phrases she's set up not to chat with kids she doesn't know but i know eventually it will happen i also use bark i would start by visiting the thorn website they have links to great resources for parents

i wanted to agree with the person who responded before me about recommending bark as a pretty good way to monitor internet use i gave my daughter's a little talk about all of this ages ago two of my better ideas was to never send a picture of themselves because pictures get shared forever and you don't know what that person is going to be doing with them that seemed to use the power of embarrassment to keep them from sending pictures of themselves i caught one of them sending pictures of actresses on disney channel and decided instead of punishing her i would give her a night of going out to a pizza restaurant for being clever also we had a conversation about where she should tell people she is from don't even use the real name of your school we worked together on it and we had note cards that they were from omaha nebraska what school they went to etc etc my kids were pretty good with writing assignments

update so the first thing i did was that i finally gave in to her request to make slime i hate slime the smell of glue makes me gag i hate the wet slurpy labia sound it makes i hate the mess i hate everything about it but we’re in a pandemic so all bets are off i went to michaels and got the glue and we had a blast it was actually very relaxing i had fun layering it with colors and we chatted and laughed while we did it slime play achievement unlocked then she’s been really into soap cutting asmr so i took two nice expensive soaps i’ve been saving for whatever and showed her how to slice off little curls then we put it into a double boiler added some shimmer pigment stirred it up and made mini soap balls that was relaxing too plus the soap was lavender scented so extra sensory bonus plus our hands were super clean afterwards turning fancy soap into a toy achievement unlocked then this morning we were sitting around she was staring at her ipad and i was staring at my phone when all of a sudden i said “the floor is lava ” and we jumped into action climbing on furniture we made our way to the empty amazon boxes waiting to be recycled ripped them up and used some duct tape to make lava resistant boots then we shuffled around the house with our lava boots on for awhile floor is lava achievement unlocked we’ve also done some dance parties and stuff but mainly i’ve found success just following her lead and trying to find my way to yes it’s been kinda fun remembering how to be a kid again

while play hasn't solved all problems i am continuously amazed that i see so few parents do it there are days where i am playful with my son from the moment we wake up to the moment we go to bed i use it as a carrot i use it for behavior modification for making mundane everyday tasks exciting and i use it because i happen to find it fun too take a simple example i am not by any means a brilliant playful parent but i'm proud of this one when the whole covid thing began my son needed to wash hands regularly but he didn't want to use hand sanitizer much less soap dispensers my girlfriend would butt heads with him multiple times a day about it you have to there is a virus out there it's not enough to simply rinse your hands etc the more you pressured the little dude the more stubborn and unwilling he became that is until the dispensers started making fart noises i'm sure i've fixed it it definitely won't make a farting noise now there is just no way dad has made it so it's completely quiet try it he pushed it and goes pffffrt while laughing hysterically we did it times and now it's never an issue to use dispensers i made up a similar game for applying sunscreen

that sounds so fun my son is still very young but i find i've somehow gravitated to making a lot of discipline a game like don't climb the stairs i'll pick you up and get you down but then he goes again and i pick him up again and put him down and then he gets this twinkle in his eye and before i know it i'm like too tee doo i'm an innocent mommy walking ar what is that no my baby wouldn't climb the stairs he wouldn't he what is he doing noooooooooooo the pick up monster is taking over and so on and it's a total blast for both of us and to my surprise he actually reduced the behavior or at least would try and catch my eye before he did it i'm a bit tongue in cheek when i describe cohen's book because well it's kind of like that it's not explicit this will solve all your problems parenting books usually aren't but then you get to the th example of the one trick solving a new completely unrelated problem and you start being like really this solved that too plenty of parenting books do that so it's not a strike against this one specifically but even if i don't want to over interpret its claims i did find it very interesting and valuable and i think its message that play solves a lot more problems than you'd think is probably correct
fart noises are the best medicine we can be in the middle of a raging argument and someone makes a fart noise and it always breaks us

that's definitely the kind of game i would have played with my son at that age he's almost now i had this talk with another reddit user parenting books are by and large absolute garbage there are a few good ones in the bunch and i think the one you mention is one of them but then it goes too far and tries to use the same hammer for every problem i like the yale course everyday parenting the abcs of child rearing because it'd actually realistic down to earth and acknowledges that you will probably only get compliance from your kid of the time another issue with parenting advice is the kind of advice made by professionals with a theoretical background who clearly don't have kids themselves you know the kind they give advice on how to stop tantrums but fail to acknowledge or take into account how exhausted most parents probably are when attempting to apply their advice i remember reading a blog from a young child psychologist who wrote that it's super simple to teach a toddler what not to touch you simply say no in a calm voice and remove them from the object of interest yeah simple as fuck now try doing it times in a row on hours of sleep with vomit on your pants and while you're hurrying to a doctor's appointment it's not that the advice is wrong it's just that people really need to take into account the emotional state of the parent

does your kid have a computer we bought our year old a computer since she is interested in programming what do you think about it did we make a mistake any tips on how to lock it down and keep it kid friendly i am thinking stick with web browser and enable parental control

set the computer for her kids in family area rather than bedroom is a good practice too like a workstation for her and she is old enough to be educated re the dangers of being online safe practices what to look out for etc
my parents gave me a computer around that age with which i taught myself programming and now i'm studying computer engineering afaik i turned out fine
scratch is a great program for kids to learn programming and it’s fun

a computer in a common area is a good idea regularly talk about internet safety not just avoiding bad sites but to never give out personal information not even age or school have good honest conversations so if something goes wrong she will come to you

we have a very tech savvy year old ever since he started playing games minecraft and roblox he's been more interested in finding out exploits hacks glitches and in general the world outside of the game itself we had some superficial website blockers that he managed to circumvent with ease i never thought we'd be playing a game of cat and mouse with such a young child over internet safety but he's just that smart we ultimately had to drop the hammer down and lock up everything using microsofts family app be cautious though because if you leave your account open they can use it to app permissions to theirs so i also make sure my pc has a short sleep timer now he has to ask us for digital permission to use sites apps etc of course continue to monitor their use and teach them online saftey if your kid is interested in tech set her up for success and ignore well meaning parents that try to discourage you from encouraging them tech is a valid hobby and career path just the same as any other and as long as we take measures to keep them safe we can mitigate the risks

my kid has had his own cheap ish chromebook for a few years as he needed it for virtual st grade in he has access to his school account and a monitored personal account via google family he's now in th grade and loves to use scratch to do fun coding projects makes pixel art with a free app and makes google slides projects with his friends as long as it's monitored via google family bark sitting with them etc i think having a computer for kids is a great idea gets them used to how to use a pc when so many only grow up learning tablets and phones

computer can should only be used in a public place before beginning with programming you should teach the yo about computers and digital citizenship i’m currently using [typingclub] for digital just as an aside my child has behavioral issues related to adhd and possibly autism in order to get him the best help during his different weekly therapies it’s important for me to have an honest idea of his behavior at any given time i personally don’t think you should have said he was fine when his behavior obviously wasn’t my mil was watching my son weekly and i didn’t know until months later that he was regularly hitting her because she always told me “he was such an angel” in all my intake power work and evals for his therapies i said he had no problem with hitting so for months i wasn’t able to help address his behavior because i wasn’t aware of it i know not all parents would be this open to feedback about their kid so maybe i’m an anomaly but if you are ever in a similar situation again as a parent of a challenging child i would appreciate even a follow up text or email if you weren’t comfortable with having that convo face to face

need suggestion or help i am parent of year old boy who just started th grade i am kind of easy going dad with my son in terms of screen time video games playing outdoors though easy going i try to limit the boundaries; weekly day for game hrs max outdoor play per day etc but my wife is very strict with parenting and never allows use of mobile phone or tablet even during travel flight or school nights i feel my son could be left out in a his digital age as all kids of similar age in the neighborhood have their own tablets or ipad and play online games at their will thought i personally don’t want him to be a exposed to lot of online stuffs i want him to be able to have balanced online exposure more background i am the working dad and ours is a single income family my wife doesn’t work at times i feel my wife is trying to be a perfect parent to compensate for not being able to contribute financially by being too restrictive and depriving him of necessary stuffs necessary stuffs like letting him more online play time let him use mobile phone better way so that he don’t need to develop being in a controlled environment i have to confess i got my son roblox gift card f without informing my wife because my wife never allows any such easy perks for him my son recently took my work phone without my knowledge and played roblox in bed my wife found that and started hitting out my son i feel my son is suffering due to inconsistent parenting or inefficient parenting between me and my spouse whenever i try to discuss and inform my wife that let him get atleast some online time or do what he wants with a mobile device she is against me hardcore and lashes out against me in anger this leads to a lot of internal disputes in family i don’t know what is the solution and also don’t want to negatively impact my sons academic growth by exposing him to games and online stuffs like youtube or netflix what is the general advice i need to know am i doing anything wrong how can i make my wife understand how i feel really same time ensure my son feels good and can shine academically as well as enjoy playing online and use ipad or tablets without feeling insecure

summertime routine for school age kids i am needing a bit of advice encouragement we are officially on summer break which has its positives and negatives lately my kids and hop on their computers first thing every morning to play minecraft roblox i sleep an extra hour and let them play while i make breakfast after breakfast we go outside swimming for a bit then head back inside for lunch i would rather them play video games than watch tv because there is some reading and strategy behind their games my question is what do your kids do when they wake up do you always wake up when they wake up thank you for any advice
my kids are around the same age and i do this if is so nice to get a bit of a sleep in sometimes i get up before them if we have plans to be ready but i love the slower down routine of the summer

my year old is usually in a day camp of some kind most weeks during the summer but there's sometimes the odd week where nothing is scheduled similar to weekends unless we have concrete plans i'll typically let him sleep in a little bit if he wants to when he gets up he will typically help himself to something small to eat he likes to eat something as soon as he wakes up i don't so that often is more like a snack to tide him over until i make us a proper breakfast he's allowed to read draw in his sketch book fuss around with whatever toys legos he's interested in at the time or go out in the back yard he's actually a very polite considerate kid so having him home during the day while i'm working is never an issue he'll choose activities that don't make a ton of noise he does have a switch and a tablet to play roblox and other games on but he doesn't have unrestricted access to these and he knows he needs permission to use them and that screen time is not something he's going to get every day
yes it is nice not to be “on the go” all year long i just feel like it’s so hard to get them off their devices once they start

how to get my year old to stop lying my son won't stop lying almost on a weekly basis i've tried the soft approach where i tell him if he tells me the truth i will never punish him which i've kept my word on i've tried the hard approach where i take away the things he loves mainly roblox or electronics altogether i've tried talking to him by trying to make him understand why lying is bad by explaining to him that losing someone's trust is a big deal i've tried asking him what he would do if he were me and his child kept lying i don't know what else to do his most current lie was telling my wife he finished his hw this past thursday he came clean to me on friday and i didn't punish him but told him he needs to finish it before its due which is this coming monday i told him i didn't care when he got it done as long as he turned it in on time i told him forgetting to do it before monday was not a valid excuse so he said he'll do it that day which was friday because he didn't want to forget well he didn't do it on friday and now on sunday night my wife asked him about his hw and he said he wasn't done yet which means he lied when he said he would do it friday i made him write lines until his bedtime and i've restricted roblox to only on the weekends these punishments are futile as i've already gone down this road and nothing seems to work this is my first and only child and my parents come from the school of whooping ass which is not something i've ever done with my child i don't know what a normal parent would do since i don't have any references is this just typical kid behavior and i shouldn't make a big deal out of it am i overreacting am i failing as a parent

does he lie about non chores related stuff lying is either caused by fear of consequences manipulation as in getting what you want testing boundaries or habit practice applies to bad behaviors just as well as good ones for the most part you should first figure out his drive to lie

you're not failing as a parent the punishments you're choosing aren't really related to the problem though which may be why they aren't really working try this approach he's lied to you about doing his homework this means he cannot be trusted to do his homework independently therefore the logical consequence of this is that his homework must be supervised pick a time since the time he picks is never he doesn't get to choose and sit down with him and watch him do it repeat for anything else he's lying about

at years old i think you need to set the schedule still set a time for homework and have them do it somewhere near you homework shouldn't become a punishment which i fear is what you are making it into with line writing and taking away things the kid loves be nearby or check in during homework time to see if your kid needs any guidance give the kid more structure figure out if it works best doing homework directly after school or just before dinner or just after dinner let the kid pick when is best but then make sure it gets done if it can't be done in front of you ask them to show you their work once it's done and then say you worked so hard for so long or you got it all done too much responsibility is being left on them since they aren't getting it done already stop with the punishment and instead create better habits or your kid may end up hating learning homework etc

i agree tiring the child out with pointless line writing isn't going to get the homework done it is punishment not a consequence without a lesson

caught my son searching adult content i need some advice i f have a son m who loves youtube & roblox we have a computer that we'd put in his room because it was the best place to put in our house due to a lack of space he's also allowed to use my husband's phone to play roblox with his sister we do limit screentime & the computer has some intense parental controls but my husband's phone doesn't have these because it's his phone however my husband was going through his phone a while back & saw some p*rnographic pictures on there that he'd not saved there was also a very inappropriate video posted onto my husband's youtube account that had gotten flagged & taken down it had a video of woman in the background & my son face fully exposed in the foreground singing some youtube meme song we went through the phone & the computer & discovered that somehow our son had managed to turn off the parental controls & was searching p*rn we cleared the history so we could tell if he did it again reinstated parental controls & had a talk with him every talk has been met with extreme emotions he's on the autism spectrum & has always dealt with intense emotions we have to take breaks in discussions to calm him down before we can continue so this conversation was met with a ton of tears even some yelling and insisting it wasn't him all he does is sob & yell that he didn't do it we know for a fact that it was him it couldn't have been literally anyone else we even caught him in the act because we'd wanted to make sure we weren't misplacing the blame we figured out that when he wanted to search something up he'd shut his door & try to be very quiet turn down the volume everything he could to be inconspicuous but since his doorknob broke months ago & we haven't bothered to replace it yet we can still see into his room & caught him red handed i need to know what else i can do the computer has been removed from his room & the only way he's allowed on my husband's phone is when he's supervised & playing roblox with his sister we also figured out that my husband's phone has a kids mode that will keep him from searching things he shouldn't my biggest concern is what's made him want to look this stuff up he's never been exposed to any of this as far as we know we're very careful about not exposing our kids to adult things literally the only time he's not supervised by us is when he's with my parents who are even more strict than we are & when he's on the bus for school our only theory is that he's hearing things he shouldn't on the bus because he for some reason despite being a tiny year old gets placed in the back of the bus where all of the highschool kids sit he hates sitting back there these kids have been bad influences before & helped him get into trouble he's fully responsible for his behavior but peer pressure is pretty rough i'm sorry i know i'm rambling i just need some advice on what to do here

if my kid already has an ipad is delaying a smart phone pointless i want to delay getting my year old a phone she wants one so bad because lots of her friends already have iphones but she currently just has an ipad i feel a little better about the ipad vs phone because the ability to take it everywhere isn’t there ipad stays home and also you can’t get all the apps you would on an iphone that is not to say my kid doesn’t already have roblox and capcut and a couple other games apps that need limits on them but overall she has decent boundaries around it daily screen time limit she can take it to sleepovers mostly so she has a way to call us via wi fi but not on regular play dates or anywhere day to day really we don’t let her take it to restaurants or have it on during meals at home not even car rides that are less than an hour now we could make all these same rules for a phone but probably would be harder to stick as one of the main benefits is she’d be able to take it with her to after school activities bike rides day to day stuff when we do end up getting her a phone we’re leaning towards a dumb phone only question is for parents who have experience is it pointless with an ipad already if we get her an iphone will there be significantly more harm than just an ipad

elementary teacher here do the dumb phone there will be significantly more harm i see the effects every day you’ve got a healthy system in place let her develop her brain more before exposing her to the phone it’s a lot of responsibility and not much good comes from it i’d hate to think what would have happened to me if i’d had a smartphone when i originally wanted one and that was at *sixteen* i didn’t get one until well into college the phone adds an element of privacy that kids aren’t ready for yet it exposes them to *a lot* of things begging for their attention and it does so at the expense of other healthy things in their life so hold off it’s okay to hold off on the smartphone you’re not hurting your kid you’re being a responsible parent

i wanted to wait until yrs old for my son but he begged and w logistics i thought fine so at yrs puberty age we git him a phone iphones have a nice parental control thing going on but let me tell you pornography is everywhere anyway he figured out the pin x 🙄 this summer he asked for ig i told him only if it's linked to my account just like i linked his tik tok to me but apps still inappropriate things found we took awsy his internet browser on his phone well some girlfriend was sending this back n forth w him on ig inappropriates if they weren't underaged i would prob talk to her and her parents alas we trying to build trust again esp bc he works on the weekends as a soccer assistant referee he kinda needs a phone we are at the point we have taken so many apps and put so many limits but still a bummer i'm in a rush lol but just put it off as long as possible good luck mama

my dad only got my brother & phone it’s one of the older ones that you slid up & press the lettered keys when we were less than double digits for safety & communication it stayed that way even till now & im as we got older he me an iphone & brother a samsung because it’s what we liked phones were a privilege if we messed up it was earned back chores were done before using our phones for entertainment on school nights we put our phones up around pm depending on age my personal feelings towards children younger than teens having + phones social media screen time is actually insane no matter age technology has negative impact on society as a whole i think kids should be kids as long as they can they need to know how to have a day framed around anything but a piece of metal battery & screen phones are distracting & addicting i think phones are necessary now but she’s only & her ipad is plenty it’s literally a bigger iphone without data i think it’s important to know how a phone works my dad knew how to put controls on it how to check history passcodes block apps etc let her brain not have the distraction & take the time now to read up on screen time the effect excessive tech screen time & social media has in children treat it like a privledge & keep boundaries up i’ve seen what a phone has done to me when i was a minor & my friends i’ve had many experiences that i shouldn’t have at the age due to some of the lack of awareness controls & other things by my parents sometimes you can’t prevent every bad thing but you can mostly edit wanted to add that i can let you know things about social media apps snap instagram tik tok etc that many parents don’t know but i personally wish more knew

set boundaries it’s more than acceptable to have *everyone* off of screens during meal time if he cannot be responsible with bed time then his screens should be taken at x time on school nights but maybe leave weekends open and let him do his thing as long as he is still able to take care of his responsibilities middle school and early high school are all hell he may be feeling lonely or having a hard time connecting with friends at school or maybe he has a lot of online friends i know my so had a lot of online friends before he got acquainted with more people here he moved to this area when he was and his online friends really helped him ask if there are any hobbies or extra curricular activities he’s interested in joining if not then see if there’s a way to connect in gaming with him it’s okay if gaming is the hobby that is joy to him

we tell our kids that they have to something i don't care what but they need to pick one organized activity my year old doesn't like sports either but is involved in theater and just got into lego robotics he loves both but probably wouldn't have started doing either if not for our rule

i had a gaming addiction when i was a teenager i would spend every waking minute online gaming i'd hurry meals to get back to it my dad would walk into my room at am and bark at me to turn off my pc my virtual life was my life i literally spent at least hours a day online i really wish my parents had made an intervention early on it was only in my early twenties and losing my first girlfriend that i but rock bottom and realised what i had to do it really sounds like your son is experiencing addiction he needs medical help to address what is underlying and fueling his addiction he needs to be cut off i would certainly seek help in the first instance as when you do cut him off all hell will break loose any action less that stopping this addiction will elicit the minimum response necessary to get you off his back so he can get right back to it i've been there this is going to be hard for you you sound like a great dad but you need to do this to help him in the long run i reckon i wasted years of my life through my gaming addiction

i’m going to be honest and i hope not to offend anyone i’ve been a long time gamer started at yr old i’ve had phases where i drop gaming for years at a time but i always seem to end up back at a computer i have the ability to literally sit for hours straight even at it’s not a healthy habit it is an addiction to escape not even about the games anymore i just want to be left alone now that i am a father of beautiful boys i find myself waiting until the boys and wife are asleep so i can sneak away this has destroyed my sleep schedule and no matter how exhausted i am i still stay up until am every night just trying to get my alone time i hope this shows how gaming can be a real issue the stimulation from gaming is almost the same as drug use the times i took a break from gaming before kids i found myself partying hard and fulfilling my addiction for escape in many other ways drugs shows relationships the reason i bring all this up is because it’s concerning i’m a good man i take great care of my family house etc but i still have the itch and am constantly depressed i think even if he hates you taking away all electronics is a great approach he may go through withdrawals etc but at least maybe that break may show him what other avenues he can explore with your guidance always remember the amount of time you put into an addiction is about half the time it will take to break it coming from an addict for all things escape try to show him not to sorry if that was a ramble

it’s hard we have a similar problem we just started non electronic time and no screens at dinner all electronics are charged in living room including kids phones none in their rooms if he is sneaky charge in your room it will be very hard at first but be consistent and firm we started small hour increments and have been able to increase the time also we turn off all electronics an hour and half before bed they shower and read or do whatever also be available for hanging out or board games during that time eventually it will get better but you will probably have a battle for a few weeks also if he goes around bugging people then he doesn’t get his stuff back he’s old enough to talk to and say what the expectations are in the family and those electronics are privileges not rights it sucked when we got serious but it’s good now still have to make sure they get off but it’s worth it also i sometimes watch my kids play and talk to them about their game or cheer them on and it has let us bond better by showing interest in their interests then it’s easier when they have to get off to want to be around me good luck

we shut off internet access to any child devices after a certain time at night and that includes cell phone wi fi access and our cell phones have limited data where they cut off all data once you reach the limit our kids have learned to preserve data or be without it for of the month when they use it all in one go it may not stop them from sneaking around and playing something off line but we did have control of internet access it's so much harder to regulate things when homework school requires a device and internet access the pandemic shot out screen limits all to hell with virtual school and each kid being assigned a chrome book from school i think you're right to be concerned this sounds like addiction my oldest is the most screen oriented but he started coding around and wants to develop video games he also has other interests the pandemic resulted in the crushing ability to pursue those and virtual school and add don't mix well so the year of virtual schooling he nearly dropped out of high school stayed up all night on social media which i'd been strict on before but discord became the only way to really stay in contact with his friends and it was a mess he was at least working during that time which at least got him out of the house and learning some practical skills thankfully he found a path at an alternative high school for his senior year and allowing him to explore options and make his own decision like considering the ged which he could have passed but would have lost out on free two years of community college which he would get by finishing high school in one of our city schools but he had a goal he really wanted which was video game design to fall back on to help get out of it once we returned to in person school activities i have loosened the screen restrictions quite a lot as my kids have gotten older but keep my eye on other factors like time spent on other activities family interactions how they treat other people in general whether they are taking care of their own needs for food sleep grooming etc and that's where the red flags come into play your kid isn't interested in family life interacting with friends in person or anything else even with his gaming online hobby he's not pushing himself to be better at it or learn more skills this has all the ear marks of an addiction i would get professional help and take some more drastic measures to detox from tech maybe best to do in the summer when there isn't school and after input from a therapist

kids need to hours of outdoor exercise every day and social interaction and its' your job to enforce that at a lot of kids would just eat and watch stuff all day if they could that can't be allowed some reddit parents will say that this is normal and your son is just an introvert but most doctors would disagree get him into some organized activities so that he can be physically active even if he goes kicking and screaming surely there must be something outdoors that he likes screens are easier but that doesn't mean there's no joy to be had in other things physical activity is absolutely necessary to health and brain development not exercise every day for a decent amount of time at this age will set your son up for huge problems not only now but down the road the damage done now can't be undone as it affects how his body develops put a list of available local activities in front of him and tell him he has to go to two consider going cold turkey on the screen time outside of school for the whole family because he sounds addicted

is it ok to tell children to “shut up it’s dad’s concentrating time” i am generally not a strict parent and have trouble telling them off unless one or the other is likely to actually get hurt or if one is likely to really upset the other i know this isn’t always the best way to be but that’s how i am so when a child does something annoying and keeps doing it regardless of what i do i’m likely to ask them to stop a couple of times i’ve long given up trying to reason or argue logic with them distract them bribe them and then if they are still doing it explode and give them a disproportionate punishment it goes without saying that this isn’t the best approach and has mixed results so what is the right thing to do if they aren’t being naughty but just annoying i often feel i don’t know what is reasonable and what is not i am considering a new tactic and wanted some feedback as to whether it’s weird unreasonable etc i love my seven year old he can be so much fun and he is so full of energy he is most likely autistic i probably am too what ever he is doing he tends to commentate it’s very annoying he is playing roblox at the moment and he keeps telling me about it but he expects me to look and he looks over to check i am we played a fair amount together today we usually do so i don’t feel guilty that i want to sit here in the same room and read some stuff i want to read some news or some articles on a website maybe i want to write something a blog post or some hobby coding but i need to concentrate for more than seconds at a time i don’t want to stop several times a minute and see what car his roblox character is driving is it unreasonable to put headphones in and tell him repeatedly if he keeps interrupting that daddy is concentrating so stfu i wouldn’t actually say it that way 😝

i mean i wouldn’t say it’s ok to tell a kid to “shut up” but i think it’s ok to say you need some quiet time or that you’re busy right now it’s not good for a kid to get used to having attention all the time anyway maybe you could set a timer maybe even a visual one so he can see how much time is left

setting boundaries is important it helps teach kids consent and empathy i highly recommend looking into response parenting and gentle parenting there’s a way to do it where you validate their feelings but give yourself the time you need to recharge check out biglittlefeelings curious parenting and drbeckyatgoodinside on instagram for good tips and foundation big little feelings is more for toddlers but can be adapted to kids i also recommend mommacusses because she shows a different side of gentle parenting which may resonate
if you suspect your both on the spectrum use that to your advantage most of us love routines so maybe from on the weekends is independent play time
i wouldn’t say stfu but if you have work or school to do then you gotta get it done if it’s recreational then just ask him to give you a minute while you finish so you can focus on him

i think this comes down to parenting style choices i generally practice gentle parenting but like you i sometimes get too lenient and then i get kinda explosive my daughter literally talks from the second she wakes up to when she falls asleep no one can stand her for more than a few minutes so i’ll be straight with her and be like “hey your annoying me can i get a little break” we also tell our kids we are “off duty” so i’ll go to my room and just say “moms off duty go to your dad if you need something” and if i have a project i don’t want to be interrupted in for example today i was hanging a shelf i’ll tell the kids “hey i’m about to go hang this shelf it will take me like minutes i’ll be off duty the whole time only come to me if it’s an emergency”— but giving them a little heads up seems to help a lot but here’s the thing we are trying to prepare our kids for the world and in the world if you are being fucking annoying people are going to get annoyed with you and that’s just life so i don’t think there is anything wrong with calmly saying “hey you’re bugging me i’m working on something i’ll check out your roblox cars when i’m done having my own time”

autistic mom to an autistic year old boy and can confirm these little dudes definitely like an audience my son will also check to make sure i’m watching whether he’s playing a game or showing me a video he also makes me answer questions to make sure i’m paying attention if he shows me a drawing or comic and i tell him i like it he asks what my favorite part is he’s just super excited about his hobbies he wants to share his excitement with anyone and everyone keep in mind that a kid like this is gonna face some social rejection even though his interests may be popular with other kids because he lacks the social awareness and impulse control to understand that most kids don’t make friends by info dumping at each other so it’s important that you teach him how to hold a proper conversation along with how to tell if someone is bored or annoyed also important that you seek out places for him to share his excitement with people in an environment where his enthusiasm will be appreciated— clubs leagues classes conventions etc the more he gets to channel his interests into opportunities for learning and social connection the less his excitement will manifest as unwanted behavior or internal shame you want to be careful not to be your kid’s first bully either just because you want your kid to stop annoying you doesn’t mean you have to make them feel bad for it teaching a lesson in the moment should generally be avoided because you’re likely to be impatient and your kid is already distracted the only message they’ll be taking away is that you wanted them to stop talking instead when you want to concentrate take preventative measures schedule your quiet time to take place after you’ve had good quality time with your kid tell him what to expect and for how long “i will be unavailable to watch or comment on anything for the next minutes while i concentrate on x if it’s not an emergency please do not interrupt i love you and it’s important for me to have this time to focus ” and make this a regular practice spend time practicing social interactions with your kid regularly and suggest alternatives to talking for times when it’s inappropriate— like making a video writing or creating something with the topic as inspiration good luck you got this
explain adults need quiet time to relax maybe make it a fun game if he lets you work he can have something in return

how would you handle an overly involved helicopter parent throwaway account…… so my daughter has had a friend in her friend group since yrs old pre k she’s now yrs old they go to school together i’ve known this mother as a parent at the school we never became friends but i’ve always remained friendly i’m an involved parent volunteer at my daughters school know her teachers help with homework and overall have a great relationship with my daughter i’m a good mother but as she gets older i believe she needs to navigate her own friendships i’m always there to listen if she has an issue or needs advice but overall she has a nice little friend group they’re a good group of kids however there is one girl whose mother has become overly involved in her daughters life to the point it is beyond helicopter parenting it’s like she has inserted herself into the friend group it’s… kind of weird honestly for example our girls there’s in the group have a group chat where they talk play roblox together or just facetime chat together there’s always lots of giggling and my daughter will share with me funny comments or stories sometimes however it has come to my attention that this heli mom will read their chats listen in on their conversations etc and then proceed to message the other parents she’s never messaged me complaining about what she heard or read and how they need to talk to their daughters about their behavior another parent in the friend group brought this to my attention as she was confused and looked through the texts but saw nothing concerning this prompted me to talk to my daughter and ask to see her texts i would like to point out i believe in protecting privacy and i trust my daughter i would never look through messages unless out of concern such as this and she knows that so together she and i went though her group chat and i also saw nothing concerning it was chatting about school stupid funny memes and roblox this heli mom wouldn’t elaborate to the other mom except to say that our daughters weren’t being “good digital citizens”… like what i believe this woman is controlling and bored and has no life or friendships outside of her daughter and is therefore inserting herself into her daughters personal life and friendships the worst part is the child of this woman is very sweet and likable but her mother is making it impossible for her to have her own friends imo knowing that my daughters own privacy would be invaded if she stays friends with this girl i’m considering suggesting she spend less time with her and not chat with her outside of school i hate this as i feel it has forced me to invade in her friendships thoughts or feedback * the above example is one issue i was also recently informed by another parent in their friend group that they no longer allow their daughter to hang out with heli mom’s daughter bc of similar overly involved behavior by heli mom *edit this isn’t about internet access i know and understand the importance of monitoring what kids see and do online my daughter doesn’t have unfiltered or unlimited access to the internet it’s about this mother reading their group texts they had via their ipads my daughter doesn’t have a phone listening to their conversations and then i don’t know commenting on it like texting the other parents that they aren’t including her daughter enough in their conversations despite her daughter being included maybe her kid had nothing to say that sort of thing it’s like she sits with her daughter during their group texts or facetime and gets upset that the girls aren’t asking her daughter enough questions or something i don’t know

should i punish my yo daughter for saying she wished she had different parents edit solved thank you all we give everything to our kids and most of the time they're super sweet and deserve it all but sometimes i feel like we spoil them especially my daughter she's the oldest so i haven't really been through this before she just told me she wished she had different parents because i wouldn't play roblox with her then she said the only reason she plays with me is because none of her friends are around to play with i've been super emotional today and this really hurt i mean i know she doesn't really mean it to hurt my feelings but should i punish her or just brush it off what do you guys do in this situation

it's fine to tell her she's welcome to have whatever feelings she has but it was rude to tell you because it was she said it to hurt your feelings she didn't say it because that's how she honestly felt i wouldn't punish because she's trying to ruffle your feathers and engage you be short and to the point you can feel however you feel but saying something just to be mean is rude and walk away i wouldn't give it any more attention or energy

she’s entitled to her feelings most kids would rather play with friends than their parent i do think a talk with her when you are calm is reasonable tell her why it hurt your feelings and how if something is bothering her will always listen but you can’t say things to just hurt someone’s feelings i would have honest conversations too about some parents are not nice maybe everyday everyone say what they are grateful for at dinner and it might open her eyes to all the good things she has
tell her you love her anyway and move on she is just a kid and it's hard to take stuff like that seriously from a kid it hurts to hear but they don't really mean it
being honest is not something to be punished for she spoke her mind you don’t like it so deal with it as you said you are emotional so is she talk down and take step back and than talk to her

she’s feeling a lot of big feelings and she’s desperately trying to make you understand the magnitude of them but she doesn’t have the bandwidth so she goes with what she knows will hurt she’s just angry i don’t think this is a spoiled thing try to sit down and talk with her about it and in that conversation you can tell her that it was a hurtful thing to say

agreed although hurtful think of the feeling behind what she's saying and see if you can get to and focus on that like it sounds like you're feeling mad angry upset frustrated sometimes having parents who don't let you do what you want is hard and don't fix it don't tell her she's wrong just validate also try to think about how you might have wanted your parents to respond to you if you said that when you were a kid and how punishment might actually have made it worse and more difficult in the future to share your feelings also *hugs* because hearing mean things from our kids suck
speaking your mind isn't a free pass to say mean things

you’re the parent so you can take away the video games kids at that age are not fully capable of regulating their behavior and doing what’s best for themselves that’s why they have parents most kids have screen time and video game limits

single gamer mom of an year old boy couple things limit screen time my kiddo is autistic so we have it tied to a reward point system we were struggling with him viewing video games as a right not a privilege so this helped both limit screen time and teach him he can't just fill his day with a game screen time is actually ok if it's productive learning doesn't count as screen time for us coding games math games online comic makers etc nor does his virtual minecraft social group my kiddo is autistic so this social learning group is a real boon last thing here's a hot take i wish more people understood *it is good to be bored * being bored is a skill it teaches us how to live with our fucking thoughts be creative gives us an opportunity to daydream shower thoughts they happen because we are unoccupied being bored is a skill that needs to be developed when my kid comes to me and says he's bored i give him three things he can do if he doesn't want to do any of them i tell him to practice being bored idk a out anyone else but my parents were busy and poor and i was always bored and yet our impulse as parents is to give our child something to do did being bored as a kid damage me no i'm fine also i'm not talking about neglect don't neglect ur kids please but a healthy boredom is fine if anyone feels like they need permission here you go it's ok to let your kid be bored

my m sons best friends are online hi all my son is only child and he is struggling to make friends at school and has made a group of buddies online with similar interests that live in other countries i worry that this is problematic for him to prefer these friends over his irl friends more details i apologize for the length my son is great his special interest is history more specifically military history he had a core group of buddies growing up but now that they are in middle school everyone has dispersed and gone their own way my son is now having a hard time relating to other kids his age he started playing roblox a few years ago and he formed a little “club” of what i am hoping are other kids and they all build and play world war games together there’s one kid in particular who he has bonded with a lot the kid lives in another country as do most of the kids in his club my son says that these kids are his best friends and are the only ones who he has common interests with i’ve just seems like year old boys sending each other memes his best friend in the group sent a voice message last week to the whole club and it sounded like a year old boy it makes me sad he doesn’t have friends in real life covid was hard for him and very isolating since then he’s gotten closer with these online friends and i don’t know if this should be concerning to me i’m glad he has kids to you have to start talking to your kid about microtransactions **now** i'm not kidding you need to warn them that there are tricks built into the game to make them spend real money and would have very real consequences advise them that if they are ever caught intentionally doing microtransactions they are forbidden from playing video games until they're old enough to understand why tell them that there have been children who racked up hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt in accidents from some of these games additionally as far as chat is concerned it can be turned off of most games most games that allow children under the age of don't have verbal chat or have a very restricted type chat have a conversation with your child about how people online talk to each other let them know not only that there are people who can be rude but there are also people trying to trick him online too best to go ahead and work in any conversations about bullying or long distance communication that you need to at this point these are all conversations you need to have before your child goes online if you listen to this advice though they'll be fine if you try to only find games to work around this problem instead of just having the conversation with them enforcing it you're going to regret it source i did this with my kid when he was he's now and he's fine and has never accidentally bought a game or a microtransaction be aware of what your kids are doing be familiar with the games they are playing be ready to answer questions as they come up and you will never have the problems you were worried about

this issue is really close to my heart have you [read this article] about a mother who went through this also—[internet matters has a page on this] you might also try a few episodes of the podcast [conversations with people who hate me] which i have found helpful and informative with regards to media literacy i encourage my son to ask a lot of questions when things don't make sense this means not being afraid to say i don't understand i also ask him to explain what he's watching or playing to me so i can gauge how he interprets the media he consumes and help him better understand things he may overlook we also talk about how people sometimes make things up esp on social media youtube because getting more attention means they get more followers views money this morning i had to tell my kid that guy doesn't actually have chapter of poppy playtime they just want you to watch so you'll buy a t shirt i honestly think one of the most important things is to help your child build and maintain a life outside of the internet specifically one that keeps him interacting with kids his age outside of school ultimate frisbee volunteering drone club whatever the internet is vast and powerful but it is also faceless

recommendations for a parenting control app my year old has been online schooling for months and it looks like he won’t go back till the next school year in august he uses an ipad for his online classes and he also has kids messenger and roblox installed on it with restrictions so no one can chat with him etc he is allowed a couple of hours to play or watch kids netflix after school in the afternoon and when that ends i use the screen time control on the ipad to block all ipad access till the next day my problem is him getting bored in class and opening kids messenger or roblox during class time even though he knows the rules are no electronics tillo school ends and even then only with permission once i found him up at night watching netflix which is why the screen control controls are now on is there a parental control app that can block app access during school hours the teachers have said they don’t want parents with them during class time and i don’t want to delete apps entirely because it’s how he plays with friends they call each other through kids messenger then play same game on roblox i’m getting frustrated because i’ll walk in and see him desperately trying to close them before i notice which obviously isn’t ok but equally i recognize that it’s been a terrible year for him and people still arent hanging out in person so he’s been very isolated and they are his main form of communication he also uses kids messenger to send message to my parents and my in laws as they live very far away any one have any thoughts or should i skip the app and just delete the apps on the grounds they causing him to break the rules once online school is over i will be able to withhold the tablet entirely if i don’t want him using it but i can’t now

i have my sons iphone an old one that isn’t activated anymore set up under my account as a child family account i’m able to set both overall screen time limits schedules as well as app categories or specific apps as obnoxious as apple can be the settings are super granular go into screen time under settings and you can set almost any schedule or time limit ie for my kiddo we have a hard screen time limit from pm am no apps at all without the password and then an overall usage limit of hours he’s btw definitely suggest taking a look at what apple offers out of the box before trying an app

so there’s “downtime” which is basically no screen time can be scheduled for specific times of day and “app limits” which can be set for a length of time then there’s “always allowed” which isn’t subject to either of those limits so maybe block everything during school hours except his school apps

oh that sounds perfect thank you and preferable to paying a monthly membership fee which it seems most of the control apps have this is all recent behavior he never used to try and use it when it’s not allowed i know testing boundaries is normal but it’s quite annoying a

online friends facing serious issues what to do i have two tween daughters that are among the millions of kids online playing roblox and such they are very well educated on online safety and have been very guarded with respect to who they talk to chat with etc there are lots of posts about the dangers to my kids but that’s not the point of this post the problem i am presenting some these online friends have a lot of serious issues safety issues like potentially abuse kids not having a safe home or in other cases talking about suicide it really impacts my kids’ overall mental state at times i don’t think i can cut them off from the internet world and i feel like they are safe from predators i monitor things closely but i am not sure how to handle this i don’t want them to ghost someone in need and i appreciate their empathy they show to others but i think they can quite quickly descend into a feeling of helplessness for these “friends” and their issues in at least one occasion the group of internet friends were trying to figure out how to contact suicide prevention for a person do we shield them from these realities do we guide them that there is a line that should be held between real friends on online “friends”

there is a reality between real friends and online friends that's true at any age the obvious difference is that you truly never know who's on the other side of the keyboard i think it's great that your kids are caring people i think you can't completely shield them and having a script to go to is helpful ultimately giving them the guide between real and online friends is necessary the truth is that there are probably some kids that are venting and need help and there are others that don't they may be older they may be making things up the truth is usually somewhere in the middle but your kids are way too young to be tasked with the responsibility of other kids safety mental health and well being

in the last thing you said both things are actually very equally true even if they are honest and year olds don’t have the experience in life or maturity to handle some issues that these kids are going there at least without my involvement

cell phone for kids what’s the right age my daughter is and will be this summer entering th grade middle school next year she has an ipad at home and we allow her access to technology and social media so she can already call text friends see tiktok play roblox etc this strategy has proven to be great thus far because she always comes to us to ask questions work through a hurtful or rude situation with friends ask what certain things mean having the chance to have a conversation and teach her etiquette and social coping skills for the tech part of her life feels important in helping her navigate it at a later age when stakes are higher and parents are not as involved this being said she is one of a very few th graders who doesn’t have a phone most had them in rd and th grade i’m not sure why this feels like a big next step but it does phones seem like a huge potential distraction at school cameras texts etc can turn inappropriate when a group of peers and no parental supervision is inconvenient ie the bus we are considering it for next school year when she enters th grade what age did your child get a phone how did it go what were the rules that worked for your family i’d love to hear
